Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Far From Sites”
Reviews.Author: mpirog85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crosti Hotel for two nights and found it to be a very nice place that was a bit far from the attractions of Rome. The hotel staff is very polite and informative and the rooms while small were clean and well appointed. The bed and pillows were hard for our tastes but after a full day of walking around the city you will barely notice. What you will notice are the lights that flickered all night in our room. The high ceiling is curved and on two of the wall there are recessed fluorescent lights that you can't see but light up the ceiling. At night these flickered dimly like a cheap aurora borealis and it was quite annoying. The bathroom is nicely appointed but the awkward tub/shower combination can be a bit difficult especially if you are a bigger person. The complimentary breakfast was nicer than most we had in Italy with a good selection of food, good coffee and courteous staff. The biggest problem we encountered with the Crosti Hotel is the location. It is right near the train station which is convenient when coming to or leaving Rome but not close to the sites. My wife and I are young and in decent shape and even we dreaded having to walk all the way back to the hotel after a full day of walking to the Coliseum, Vatican City, etc. There is also not too much around the hotel which mean slim pickings for dinner at the end of the day. Overall however we were satisfied with the hotel and would recommend it to people staying a couple days in Rome, however if you plan to walk around the city stay somewhere more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: debina s
Reviews.Content: 9/10. Great stay! Recommended highly for travelers looking for value in money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcela G
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending 3 nights here. The room was good side and always clean. The bathroom was comfortable and hot water was not an issue. The Hotel is very close to train and bus stations about a 5 to 10 minute walk not an issue even with suitcases. We arrived in Rome by plane and had arranged our pick up in advance with the Hotel. Best decision we made! After traveling for 14 hours, the last thing we wanted to do was had to find a taxi. As soon as we walked out of the baggage claim area there was a person with our name that directed us to the driver of a large A/C van with plenty of room, specially since there was only 3 of us. The best part it was only 37 Euros, plus tip. We arrived at 8am so our room was not ready, but we were able to leave our baggage, brushed or teeth, and were advise on places to go "Rome-ing" around. Tip: is you plan to use buses and train, buy the Roma pass, you can get it from the hotel lobby and it will end up saving you some money. It also includes 2 museums. Our room has 3 single beds with plenty of room to walk around. The beds were comfortable and there is one huge window you can open and get fresh air. We were in room 103 which is at the end of the hall on top of the breakfast area, so if you are a light sleeper you might want to have a room higher up, you can hear noise early in the morning. Breakfast was great! Eggs, bread, pastries, juices, milk and of course lots of coffee. The girl that helps in the breakfast room is super nice and make great coffee. The receptionist were all nice and friendly. Specially the older gentlemen at night, he was SUPER friendly! The one in the morning, would help you and answer questions, but didn't look like he really like his job. He wasn't mean. The hotel own a restaurant, it was ok, but you can find a lot better options if you go wonder around. just up the street you can find at least 10 more. So overall a great place to stay for the money! also, we did all of our booking through Europeandestinations.com and didn't have any problems, everything we bought we got :O)

Reviews.Title: “Very good value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiteBear21
Reviews.Content: Convenient location about 10 mins walk from Termini station and near to another Metro station. In a residential location with some nearby bars restaurants,walking distance to most of the sights except Vatican which required Metro journey. Room was very well equipped, clean and very quiet, although we hardly spent any time in it! Reception very helpful, supplying maps, although not over friendly. Breakfast was very good quality with lots of choice and the girl who helped in the breakfast room was very nice & friendly. Had dinner at Da Vicenzo, a local restaurant recommended by hotel and was given a 10% discount as guest of hotel, but I would not recommend eating there as it was average quality and quite expensive even with discount. Would definitely recommend 'Est Est Est' pizzeria if you like pizza. The oldest pizza restaurant in Rome, about 15 mins walk from hotel - but get there early as it is always crowded. Can definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again if visting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: Good location near the Termini. Good well equipped room(108). Superb breakfast. Helpful,welcoming staff.Could not be bettered for price and value for money. Will recommend to every one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: robtt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights . Our room (104)reasonably spacious ,nice bathroom ,if a smallish shower,and immaculately clean . Good quality bedding and towels as a bonus. Reception helpful giving advice on nearby restaurants etc. breakfast excellent even offering a choice of different coffees ...nice touch. Best city hotel we have stayed in price for price. One bit of advice is if you are a light sleeper take some ear plugs .The hotel is no worse or better in this respect to any other but you are in a big noisy city !!

Reviews.Title: “Would've been a 4 if not for the smell.”
Reviews.Author: kennymac1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a junior suite, which was a flat in a common stair about 400 yards and 5 minutes walk away from the hotel, and little to suggest you were in a hotel. In the same common stair were "Hotel Sandra" and what appeared to be locals' homes. The first suite we were shown (apartment 12) smelled unpleasant so we asked to move and were put in apartment 18, which also smelled, but to a much lesser degree. We asked if we could stay in the hotel, but it was full. The smell went away when the windows were opened, but came back on average once or twice a day - a problem with the drains/plumbing possibly. There was a washing machine in the bathroom, a few inches from your knees, and a microwave in the sitting area, where you might expect a TV. The shower was one of the ones where it randomly went hot and cold. So much for the negatives, although I wasn't that bothered by them. My girlfriend hated it at first but after a few days she didn't mind so much. The positives are that it overlooked a courtyard and was quiet, the bed was comfortable, it was very clean, the building was nice, it had a lift, it was relatively cheap, the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was varied and tasty and you could eat as much as you wanted. I spoke to someone who was staying in the actual hotel, and he thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie D
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Crosti for 4 nights while we were in Rome, and were very impressed. We booked our trip with european destinations, and this was the recommended hotel. The staff was so friendly, particularly the gentleman working the desk in the evenings. I emailed them and they arranged to have a driver pick us up at the airport, which was great. The room was clean, large, and modern, with a mini fridge to store some drinks in. We found the hair dryer when we were packing to leave. There is also a small safe. The highlight of our stay was the breakfast each morning. This was no common continental breakfast. As you walk in, the lady working the room asks you for your coffee order. The cappuccino was amazing! How will I ever be able to drink american coffee again after that? If you order regular coffee, they bring you a carafe and cream. It is the best coffee I've ever had. The buffet has wonderful prosciutto, meats and cheese, pastries, breads, eggs, fresh fruit salad, and delicious pears that taste like they are sweetened with honey, just to name a few things Everything was so tasty. Crosti is a 5 minute or less walk from 3 metro stops and the Termini. This is handy since none of the major attractions are very close. We found it convenient enough to return to our room for a bit each afternoon. There is a small elevator, which is nice when you are too worn out from walking to climb the stairs. We discovered a great grocery mart just down the street. Head down Castelfidardo towards the Termini. Just before you hit the first major intersection, turn right and about a half a block down, near the taxi stop, you will see Conad on the right. We couldn't believe the price of drinks there! When you pay 3.50 euros for a Coke at a restaurant, it is nice to be able to buy some for the hotel for 50 cents. They also have a great and cheap wine and beer selection. The mini fridge came in very handy! We highly recommend the hotel, and always felt so welcome walking through the door. There are plenty of places to eat or get a snack right on the street, and the metro is a few minutes away. I hope to stay with them again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wings007
Reviews.Content: I thought that hotel was a great value. The location is great. Just a 5 min walk to the subway station (blue line) and a 10 min walk from the main station if you choose to walk. You are a 10 min subway ride to the Coliseum and 10 min ride to the Vatican. The hotel staff is very friendly and go out of there way to make your stay very enjoyable. I stayed in an apartment witch was a 3 min walk from the front desk. The rooms were very clean with free Wi-Fi, bottles water and coffee. I would recommend this hotel to any families, business travels, friends or if you’re solo.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with exceptions”
Reviews.Author: lad_v_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for almost a week. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was really good as it kept us going until dinner. Hotel is within walking distance to major sites in Rome's historical centre. Termini station is only 10 min away. The only problem we experienced during our stay was noisy room because of the proximity to the hotel's reception and street outside our window. We had a ground floor room and the reception desk and breakfast area were only a few yards away from our door. This obviously generated a lot of noisy traffic. A particular "lowlight" was that hotel cleaners had their morning chat every day right in front of our room door. Our room was also right above a large television set in the basement breakfast area and one night there was a broadcast of a football match. I had to go and ask people who were watching the match to turn the volume down because it was so loud that we could not sleep. In conclusion, it is a good hotel but ground floor location was bothersome. So if you get a ground floor room arm yourself with a set of earplugs to get a descent night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: miroma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few minutes' walk from Piazza Repubblica and about 10-15 minutes' walk from Termini railway station. You can actually walk to most attractions except perhaps the Vatican but that is easily reachable by metro. My room was a good size with a comfortable double bed, a writing desk, and a spacious wardrobe, and faced the courtyard (not much of a view but it was very quiet). The only thing that put me off was that one of the walls was terribly dirty as if someone had been lying across the bed pressing their shoed feet against it but I decided to take it easy. The bathroom with a shower cabin was very clean though. The climate control in the room worked perfectly. There is wi-fi in all the rooms - it is not free but you only pay 5 euros for your entire stay, which is next to nothing. Breakfast was served in the breakfast room downstairs and was the usual kind of Italian breakfast - a selection of cheese and sausage, muesli, hard- boiled eggs, and some pastry (no hot options). The breakfast room was never crowded - in fact, as I always came early, I hardly saw anyone there. The reception staff were all very nice and the grey-haired man who checked me in (I am sorry I did not find out what his name is) was a real gem - very friendly and super helpful. He gave me some good advice, explained where everything is and how to get there, helped me carry my bag a few steps up to the elevator, and supplied me with an adaptor. All things considered, a very nice 3 star hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who needs a well-located and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: gerrysc56
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents good value for Rome. The rooms are clean and quiet and the breakfast is good. The staff is friendly and speak good English. One of our party had a medical event during our stay and the staff was very helpful. There are numerous restaurants in the area. This is obviously close to the train station and the Termini area has an undeserved reputation. The area is much nicer than many years ago. We all felt safe even late at night. The convenience of the proximity to the train station is balanced by being farther away from the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Liisaa_123
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived, we saw how lovely and modern the hotel looked. We checked in and the receptionist showed us to the room and helped us with the luggage. He then showed where everything is in the room. We stayed for 4 nights and The hotel was PERFECT. The rooms are a good size with very comfortable beds and a large ensuite bathroom. 2 large bath towels, 2 head towels, 2 hand towels and 2 flannels are provided every day along with Showergel & shampoo. The room and bathroom are kept clean as a cleaner comes everyday. There is actually nothing you can pick fault with about the rooms. There is a road outside which the first night was a little noisy untill we realised that there were shuttered outside the double glazed windows. So once we closed them along with the window, it blocked out all noise and all the light. The hotel staff are very friendly and will go out there way to help you. We went out for a meal every night and asked the receptionist where they recommend. Every night they recommended a place and gave us a map to help us find it. The hotel has there own resturant which is 2 minute walk down the road. If you tell them youre staying at crosti, they give you 10% off the food bill. The food and atmosphere was lovely. So when you get to the Hotel, ASK about there resturant. The Hotel also has a continental breakfast with a selection of breads, cereals, pastries, fruits, meats, cheeses, etc. It was lovely. The hotel is situated a couple of minutes walk from a large supermarket and a 5 minute walk to the local Metro and the Termini station. We decided to walk to the centre everyday which took about 20 minutes. its definitely worth walking as you see alot more of Rome. We were sad to leave and we recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: milli447
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before check in but they were more than happy to hold our luggage for us until then so that we could go and wander around straight away. Shown to room which was above the breakfast room, and I must warn that this could be loud, I'm a good sleeper and I heard it, so recommend taking earplugs if you think this might bother you. Room good size, basic but clean, was always out anyway. Didn't have any issues with the bed really, was so tired from walking around all day it didn't matter too much. Tv with cable but mostly italian, no coffee/tea making facilities but fridge so we bought bottles of coke and kept them in there. One thing we realised - very expensive to buy small bottles when out and about, so got ours from super market which is near buy or bought local drinks such as cappucino when out as they are cheap! Breakfast was nice with good continental selection, meats, cheeses, pastries, youghurts, fruit etc. And staff made the coffee of your choice for you in the morning. Some say that the area is dodgy, I didn't think it was. Never felt in danger when walking around, although there was one time when we got off at termini station at night and walked back when there were some people hanging around which was a little intimidating (although they didn't bother us), but we got off at castro pratorio most other times which is nearer to the hotel, and is one stop from termini, so we just changed as the metro is very easy to use and you can travel for 70 mins on 1 euro. The hotel was in a good location for us personally, as it was a little bit out of the way, but still close enough to everything. It didn't take very long to get anywhere at all. And maybe made it a bit more of a novelty when we did go out, as opposed to walking out of a hotel directly in front of the trevi fountain for example. Although some people may prefer somewhere closer and more convenient so bare that in mind. We would stay here again upon returning to Rome which we hope to do at some point, staff were nice rooms were adequate, location just fine for us. Also, the hotel runs a restaurant down the same street, that do great seafood dishes (recommend the seabass!) cant think of the name but ask at reception. Also, recommend staying for a minimum of 3 night, we stayed for 2 but had 3 whole days and didn't quite feel it was enough. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the difference :)”
Reviews.Author: DFWSusan
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff. They were awesome. Clean, good location. Breakfast every day was more than adequate. Yes, beds were very hard. Grocery about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1512
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 nights at The Crosti Hotel and the overall experience was okay really. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the room was very basic but clean. We had a lovely big room with a King size bed and a view of a courtyard which made it very quite until about 6.30 in the morning when some staff members arrived and slammed the door downstairs. It is an old building with high ceilings so sound travels!! We had a nice big bathroom as well with a jacuzzi which none of us fancied using as that wasn't particularly clean. The only thing that the rooms could really use are som comfy chairs to sit in as you only have the bed to sit/lie on, or the desk chair. The breakfast that was included was perfectly adequate and had all you needed for a Continental breakfast plus more. The hotel is within easy each of Termini (Railway station) and once you get your bearings you can also take bus 62 which will stop very close to the hotel as well if you have a night out in the centre of town and won't pay for a taxi home. Every major attraction is not far from the hotel, but good walking shoes are essential as you find yourself walking much further than you anticipated as there is so much to see. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will most definitely come back to Rome in the near future, and would stay at the Hotel Crosti again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel B & B”
Reviews.Author: Ybloem S
Reviews.Content: A fairly small hotel - our preference - providing rooms and breakfast. The room we had (106) was a large double which had an adjoining room with 2 more spaces for 2 additional guests (there were only 2 of us). This room had the en-suite adjoining + 1 separate toilet (so 2 loos - brilliant!), spotlessly clean, very modern, very comfy. The continental breakfast spread was comprehensive, lots of choice, with breakfast staff available for hot drinks. Front of desk staff allways on hand, pleasant and helpful. Hotel is close (but not too close) to the main train station in a 'hotel' neighbourhood with plenty of nice little restaurants. We are 'walkers' so we walked to the attractions every day during our 4 day stay. Can't fault the place - we will return here for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Stivi_M
Reviews.Content: I have been many time in Termini area, but Hotel Crosti is the best you can find in this area. Room was new and very clean, bathroom was spacius and clean, breakfast was very good.The location is perfect because the hotel is 8/10 minute walk from termini station, Terravision bus Stop and the main metro station so you can reach every place in few minutes. Very good service and staff as well I will come back again...

Reviews.Title: “had such a lovely time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmieJuicy
Reviews.Content: We had such a lovely time at this hotel - It's so close in walking distance from Castro Pretorio metro or from central termini. When we got there at about 2pm, the room wasn't ready which was a bit annoying as we were so tired having gotten up early for the flight etc. So - an hour later the room was ready and it was so comfy and cosy - my only annoyance was that it was so close to the reception and the cleaners would sort out their trolly right outside the room at 7AM. Pros: Breakfast yummy! Huge beds, Clean rooms, Friendly staff, Powerful Shower. Cons: NOTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurenmiller85
Reviews.Content: Pros: -HUGE rooms -HUGE bathrooms -HUGE beds -Nice breakfast -Great customer service -Great shuttle service to and from the airport -great hotel rooms and bathroom (lots of space, heated bathroom floors, heated towel rack, etc) Cons: Only one i can think of and its not a huge deal..but the hotel isnt in the heart of the city. I mean its in rome but you have to walk a good 20 minutes to see major sites. I would have loved to be a 5 minute walk from major site but then i would have been paying a lot more im sure

Reviews.Title: “Definately a good choice”
Reviews.Author: cksapr10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Crostic hotel in Rome and must admit that the hotel room is really big and spacious. It is also one of the cleanest too! The location is also convenient.The staff are friendly and helpful. Will highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Workable but better out there”
Reviews.Author: coronashines
Reviews.Content: This is a budget friendly hotel. I would look elsewhere before booking. It is within walking distance to the train station but not much else. Room is average for European hotel. Nothing fancy. Breakfast standard (pastry, yogurt, juice, coffee)

Reviews.Title: “Too loud to sleep well”
Reviews.Author: Jordan G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in Rome, Florence and Venice, and this hotel was our least favorite. There were a couple reasons we didn't love it compared to the others. First of all, we were given a room directly above the breakfast area and it was unbelievably loud in the early, early morning hours. It was really frustrating for us because we couldn't sleep through it (we're talking about 4 am- 5 am). I'm assuming others rooms have a better situation and maybe we just got unlucky there. The hotel staff wasn't very friendly (again, this isn't according to American standards– this is compared to the other hotels we stayed in during our Italy trip). They weren't rude, but they weren't nice either. The room is plain and functional. The shower is very tiny, and it's the only room we stayed in that didn't have a bathtub. Each other hotel also had a hair dryer, but this one did not. The bed was really firm, but we found that to be true of all the hotels we stayed in. Italians like a firm bed and thin pillows! The breakfast was OK. Again, it was our least favorite of the three hotels we stayed in. It's totally great that it was free, but we couldn't find many things that we liked. We ended up eating hard boiled eggs and bananas. It's not super close to many sites, but we were able to travel to everything on foot (although our legs were beyond tired and many people would probably take public transit). There are some restaurants nearby, so that helps. It is close to the Termini. The value of the hotel probably reflects the concerns we listed above. I would advise you to ask for a room that's not above the breakfast area, especially if you are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Di_Mick78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Crosti Hotel at the beginning of a 3 week holiday. The hotel is in a quiet location not far from the Termini where our shuttle bus from the airport dropped us off. We were able to walk to the hotel with our luggage with little fuss. We had an extremely good welcome at check-in and we took the small ancient lift to the 3rd floor. The room was very comfortable, no complaints whatsoever, culminating in a very relaxing sleep over the next 3 nights due to the hotel’s quiet location. Had breakfast at the hotel in the downstairs dining room on each of the 3 days and were very impressed. A typical continental breakfast with a good variety of meats, cheeses, pastries, cereals etc, coupled with very good service. Rome is certainly a walking city and we found that the Crosti’s location was well within walking distance of all the major sights, and this allowed us to explore more of the city than we had originally planned. There are some nice restaurants close by including La Vincenza (just up the street) which the hotel has an affiliation with and provides discount. Had a lovely lunch there prior to our departure. We would recommend the Crosti Hotel to anyone staying in Rome and would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: frizzanteNyc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Crosti and couldn't have been more pleased. The front desk staff were very friendly, helpful and accomodating. They helped us with a few "strange" requests! The morning breakfast was great and free, full of a variety of foods, drinks and snacks. The room was plain, small yet very clean. The bathroom had a funky tub/shower combination but was fine with us. The neighborhood was a quick walk to 2 food stores, a pharmacy, the Termini train station, a gelati shop, great restaurants, and Plaza Reppublica. All in all, stay here, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonTess
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend break to Rome with my daughter. Crosti Hotel was a very good base for our stay well located near to Rome Termini Station. It was slightly further than I'd imagined from the historic city centre but then again I think the good value price reflects that. The room and bathroom were spotless and breakfast was very good. The reception staff that we encountered were helpful and pleasant and the recommendation to the local restaurant which is run by the hotel owners was very good indeed. Not the quietest spot I've ever stayed in, particularly if you want to sleep with the windows open as I do, but in a city like Rome I doubt very much if you'd find any location where there's no noise!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: AGTHarborSprings
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Crosti Hotel and loved it. The front desk gentleman helped us with the layout of Rome and how to see it in just a few hours. We needed an early morning taxi to the airport and they arranged it. The breakfast buffet was AMAZING and incredible. Our room was clean and comfortable. We walked from the train station to the hotel which was easy. You do not need to pay any of the men waiting outside the station some Euro's to find the hotel. It's literally ten minutes away. We took the Metro to the Colliseum and did the remainder on foot. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and near the train station”
Reviews.Author: Traveller853
Reviews.Content: My first impression was not that good because the man on the reception was not exactly welcoming. He was efficient but not friendly - not the sort of person you would want to ask any advice from. I discovered later that the other staff were much friendlier. The room was in an excellent condition. It was clean with everything working including air conditioning and a good safe. I have known worse 4 star rooms. There was no problem with the noise from the outside but there was a problem inside, however. The walls were very thin and you could clearly hear the toilets being flushed and the use of showers. It was impossible to sleep when the night owls came in at 3.00 am, slammed the doors and ran the shower for an hour. There was a nice room for breakfast and the Italian style breakfast was good, especially if you have a sweet tooth - lots of cakes - but don't expect sausages and bacon. The lady managing things seemed nice. The location of the hotel is quite good for Termini station. It takes about 10 minutes to walk it. If you only have one day to explore, as I did, it is a good idea to go to nearby Castro Pretorio underground station ( you might get hassled at Termini) and buy a 4 euro one day pass that can also be used on the buses and trams. The only problem with the public transport is that it can get very crowded and you should keep hold on to your valuables. There is also the nearby Conad supermarket which was great for stocking up provisions for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful but a rip off”
Reviews.Author: bonadette
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, spoke good English, porter to take up bags. Old style cafe lift but we were on first floor. Room spacious by European standards but cracks and marks on walls. Safe in cupboard and bar fridge with 4 bottles if water and 3 soft drinks for 'mini bar'? Bathroom modern with cool spa bath with 'tube' for standing jets etc but lots of mould! Cleaners did not vaccuum after we had broken a glass the night before (& reception had asked us what we wanted them to do... We just wanted to inform them)... No wifi available! Only cable connection for laptops. Restaurant down road reccommendef by crosti, 10% disc, really good. 5-10 min walk to termini station, 10-15 to colosseum or Trevi fountain. Good quiet area in Rome. Do not do Vatican tour they recommend, they were Terrible. Breaky good, free real coffees made for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the train and metro”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelllers
Reviews.Content: We choice this hotel on the tripadvisor's comments and location to the train station. We arrived very early around 10.30 and we did not expect to be able to get our room but we were checked in immediately! great start the man that checked us in was very efficent and gave us a map of Rome and highlighted the main attractions - it was such a shame he did not smile it would have made the experiance a whole lot better, he called a porter who was great he happily took our cases to our room and explained about the safe, air condtioning etc . The room was spacious and clean - the shower was great hot and forceful! The breakfast was good - plenty of choice, cereal, fruit, yogurt, cakes, eggs, juice, coffee you could fill yourself for the day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AdSchu
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was short, so it was especially nice to have such a marvelous place to stay. Its proximity to Roma Termini was close enough that we were able to walk and not have to bother with a cab. Check-in made a great initial impression with the very pleasant, English-speaking gentleman at the front desk. We were greeted warmly and were given a very good map with a brief course on nearby attractions. Our room was wonderful! It was a corner room so we had windows on each side of the room with nice views down the adjacent city streets. It had a streamlined feeling with contemporary fixtures and furnishings and was clean and in good order. The only complaint I could make here is that the beds were very firm, but I know that is just my opinion. The bathroom was very nice and even looked recently renovated. It was very clean and pleasant to use. The air conditioner worked very well, which was so welcomed at the end of a hot, active day. The hotel's breakfast is exceptional. They provide a wonderful variety of food and drink that should satisfy any taste. It is especially good for those of us who plan to walk all day and see as much as possible. Their breakfast makes for a really great start to the day. It is great to know that when we visit Rome again, we already know of the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rome Hotel with a Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lkdancer
Reviews.Content: The Crosti is a little off the beaten path in the bortheast corner of Rome as far as the main attractions of the city; here the neighborhood feels more like a modern city than old Rome. However, if you like to walk you can easily reach all that you want to see. The rooms were comfortable and a nice size compared to other Italy hotels we eperienced. The flat screen TV was a nice touch and the bathroom was an adequate size and modern as well. The shower stall was a little narrow with not much room to move in. The only other minor complaint was there there was no mirror or vanity area in the bedroom. Pietro D'Antonio at the front desk was always jovial and happy to see us an asssist with recommendations for restaurants or anything else we needed. Compared to other Italy hotels, the breakfast offerings were nicely diverse and very fresh, with an attentive staff person to bring hot coffee to the table. A good value and comfortable hotel if you don't mind walking to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Owned Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: cruzin4436
Reviews.Content: I loved loved loved this hotel!! My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 days in August and it was our favorite hotel of the whole trip. The rooms are nice and spacious, the beds are soft and comfortable, the bathrooms are large and clean, no view but the fact is you are going to be out all day anyway! The breakfast is really amazing and there are plenty of delicious things to try. The location is great, it’s very close to the train station, close enough that we just walked with our bags. The downside is that there is no internet in this hotel, when we asked about it he told us to wait until after breakfast, after breakfast he pulled out his personal laptop and set it up for us to use. This worked fine for us but really wireless internet would have been handy (there is a café a few blocks away with wireless internet) The BEST part about this place is the little old man who owns it! He was so cute that I wanted to take him home with me! My boyfriend and I were walking out the door dressed for dinner and we hear “Where are you going?” (sorta felt like we had to tell dad where we were going before we left the house lol) we turned to tell him that we were going to dinner and his face lit up. “Little corner little corner” he began to tell us and he searched the desk for their business card. I probably looked pretty confused but he clarified that little corner was the English name of the restaurant that his friend owned. He told us that we should go there and we agreed he then looked at his watch and frowned “Don’t know if they will be open” he then picked up the phone and began laughing and speaking in rapid Italian with what was clearly a good friend of his. As he continued his conversation on the phone he scooted us out the door and sent us on our way to dinner. Overall the place he sent us was amazing but was more amazing was the experience. Overall I loved that this hotel was family run and you could tell that they really cared! I would stay here again anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place, I'd recommend it”
Reviews.Author: theakston50
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the room was an adequate size with all the facilities you need, it was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. It's very well located near the main station although my only minor issue is that it's a good walk away from some of the main attractions, although most are easily reached by a short train journey. To put that in context though you would pay a lot more for hotels nearer the main attractions. In general it was a great little hotel that was good value for money with great staff and I would very much recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Carol C
Reviews.Content: After my first taxi ride in Rome over ten years ago, staying at a hotel walking distance to Rome's main train station, Termini, is a requirement! Hotel Crosti meets that requirement and so many more! The hotel staff could not be more accommodating! The hotel is sparkling clean and in updated condition, including a well-functioning air conditioning system. Claudia, the breakfast lady, is a jewel! She is at the ready in the morning with a cappucino, or whatever type of coffee you'd like. Great included breakfast buffet! If you choose to stay at this hotel, don't miss having dinner at La Familia restaurant just around the corner! We liked it so much we ate there 3 evenings in a row, trying something different each time.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: Loafinbaker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Crosti was recommended to us, and it did not disappoint. The staff was genuinely helpful with directions, recommendations for food, and accommodating to all our needs. There were 5 of us, 2 couples and a 12 year old boy. We had 2 rooms, one regular and one suite, and they were ample sized, larger than we expected for European hotel. The rooms were clean, well appointed, and comfortable. There was breakfast in the hotel that was part of our room rate, and it was quite good. Very strong coffee! There are plenty of things to see within walking distance, and a large bus depot is nearby, that gives access to many points in Rome. We did not have a car, so parking was not an issue with us, but there is very little parking near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LewisK20
Reviews.Content: The overall status of the Hotel was better than I had expected. We were greeted by a friendly man at the counter who had also showed us to our room and pointed out a few things in the room such as the mini bar (very mini) and magnetic key card. My flight arrived very early that morning but luckily they allowed an early check in at no extra charge. We reserved a double room and it was a good size for the two of us. It is smaller than what you would expect in America but I was not disappointed. The bed was a bit firm but my girlfriend found it to be comfortable. The only downside that I had, was due to their efforts on energy conservation, once you removed your key card from the room, it would turn off all the lights and air conditioning. Even thou the "going green" intent is there, is was disappointing coming back to a warm room after a long day of walking. Once the a/c is on thou, it was pretty effective. The shower was a standing shower only and was big enough for one. The water pressure was decent. Breakfast was good. Once you walked into the dining area, you could ask for your type of coffee(coffee, espresso, cappuccino, or cafe americano) and then select from assorted fruits, yogurts, breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, boiled eggs, and sort of breakfast quiche. The location was very close, about 10 minute walk, to the termini. The distance really complemented the use of our Roma Pass. There were a few restaurants within a 5 minute walk that we tried and were decent. Did a lot of walking in the evening hours as well and never felt threatened or worried. Overall, I would recommend this Hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: Olene55
Reviews.Content: The Crosti surpassed our expectations as it wasn't high in the Trip Advisor rankings. We found it to be immaculaty clean, our room was spacious and the bathroom was large and modern. The breakfast was excellent. Fresh fuit salad and the frittata were highlights for us. Only a short walk from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: csquared22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August 2011 for 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. The location is great. It is very close to the Termini Station. We walked from the hotel with our suticases to catch our train to Florence with no problems. We never felt the least bit unsafe around the hotel (or anywhere else in Rome). There is a supermarket a couple of blocks away where you can purchase water, wine, and other things that you might need. We walked to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and all other sites - except for the Vatican - without any problems. Breakfast was typically European and consisted of various meats and cheeses, bread and rolls, yogurt, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, cereals, and several sweet pastry dishes each day. The lady that got us coffee each morning was very friendly and worked extremely hard. The room could use a fresh coat of paint, but was comfortable. My husband found the bed a bit too hard, but I didn't have any problems. The shower is small, but not unlike other European hotels. The room was cleaned each day and fresh towels were always provided. You can purchase and internet connection for only 3 Euro which lasts 24 hours, but the hours are not cumulative. So if you use 1 hour on the first day, 2 hours on the second, and then 2 hours on the 3rd, you will still have 19 hours of internet time left. We could connect in our room with a cable, or you can use a laptop provided by the hotel in the breakfast area. All in all we very much enjoyed our visit. We would recommend this hotel to our friends if they were going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off the tourist laden path”
Reviews.Author: klever08
Reviews.Content: The location of the Crosti is great and partly because it's not directly down town will all other expensive, touristy hotels. It's on a quiet street and the hotel is relatively small so you don't feel crowded. The beds were a little hard but the room was certainly clean and bathroom was very nice. The air conditioning was key in August and it worked well! Breakfast was tasty although there were a lot of dessert type things. The coffee is great! Also VERY reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fully Recommend, thank u Trip Advisor!!”
Reviews.Author: emily0113
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed in the apartments and they were spotlessly clean. We had 2 apartments(booked July 20-23) which were great sizes. They were located within minutes of a subway stop and a grocery store, great convenience. We walked to the Colossuem, about 20- 30 minutes and the same to the Spanish steps. Breakfast had a lot of selection and was very good, you could also order cappuccino and espresso, which was included. Service at the hotel was great, Germanno at the front desk had great customer service. When I checked in, he already knew my name, it felt like home. On our checkout day, as we were leaving the hotel, he even gave us umbrellas to borrow as it was raining. I will be staying here whenever I am in Rome, recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Will recommend”
Reviews.Author: Howard S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great! About 10 minutes walk from Termini and easy to find. We were warmly welcomed and assisted to our room. The rooms are fresh and modern and the bed comfortable. Our room faced the street, but we were not disturbed by any traffic noise. The breakfast was delicious with a wide selection. And real espresso! We were directed to a restaurant nearby for dinner and were not disappointed. We went back the next night. Overall, a very satisfying choice and we would not hesitate to recommend the Crosti Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Italy - perfect for what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crosti in early August 2011. It was very close to the train station, which was a must for us. We had a driver from the hotel pick us up at the airport. Our incoming flight was delayed for 4 hours and yet he was still there, waiting for us with no problems. I highly recommend this service for a stress-free arrival! The hotel was clean and the room was exactly what we wanted: modern looking, nice private bathroom, air conditioning, good water pressure, safe, and quiet. It was perfect. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy! (We were also in Florence and Venice.) FRESH as it gets. The coffee and fruit salad were superb. The coffee was made by the breakfast attendant right when you ordered it! Great capuccino as well. Giovanni and Marco at the front desk helped us get oriented with a map and the best bus routes and metro routes to get to where we needed to go. They also watched our luggage after we checked out and before our train to Florence. (Thanks guys!) There is a grocery store right down the street so we got snacks and some cheap wine and dinners there a few nights. This is a great way to save some money because you might get hosed at some of the touristy spots. Overall, my favorite place we stayed in Italy! Great attention to detail! :) I would definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: YarraValley7
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed at this Hotel in June, 2011. From the first moment of our arrival, I was not impressed with this Hotel. Not because of its appearance but because of the concierge/reception man on duty that day. We obviously struck the same person who has been mentioned in other reviews. This man was rude and unhelpful. For example, we arrived on a Sunday and I asked where we could buy milk. His answer was, “It’s Sunday, nothing is open. You could try some of the bars in the area.” My husband and I subsequently went looking and asked at a café where we were told that the Railway Station (which is not very far away), has plenty of shops open on Sundays! We were not the only people he was rude to – I heard him on the phone one day being rude to someone else. You are able to use the Hotels laptop (at a charge) but asking this particular staff member to set it up for you, made you feel like you were bothering him/interrupting his day! Hotel staff should not make their guests feel this way. Fortunately he was the only one like this as other staff we met were friendly and helpful to the point that we even gave some of them small gifts unique to Australia. The room was quite small and we were given 3 single beds. I found mine to be extremely hard and had to place a spare bed cover under the base sheet to make it softer. There was not enough room for all our cases which resulted in one having to be put on the bench that covers the fridge. There were no tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom did not have enough space for toiletries around the basin area. The room was very clean and well serviced during our stay. Breakfast was OK especially if you have a “sweet tooth”. Prior to staying there I believed that it was in a “safe” area. After staying there, I now know the area is not safe to walk around in at night. Neither is the Termini Railway Station. One of our tour drivers also pointed out that some of the streets in this area are not safe to walk down. There are lots of restaurants but the 2 we tried we did not like. I chose this hotel because of the positive reviews here on TA. I see that my review will be “the odd one out” amongst the current reviews. Perhaps the staff member I’m referring to has left. However, I would still not stay here again due to the uncomfortable bed, no decent restaurants in the area and because it is not in a safe part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdarco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Crosti Hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is small but very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpfull. The room we stayed in was as expected, clean and comfortable. The elevator though is really small but that's not a big problem. The hotel is 5 min. walk from Termini station where you have all transportation options. I would definitely stay at Crosti again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to discover Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TinyLeu
Reviews.Content: Very nice, newly renovated Hotel near Termini Station (short walk). Nearby a lot of nice Restaurants with great italian food. The Hotel is cleen, has very good beds, the only minus was the water temperature of the shower, which was only medium warm without possibility to make it warmer. Breakfast is very nice, lots of self-.made cakes, omletts, cheese, meat etc. It's a little too loud to sleep with windows opened, but it had a good air-con in our room so it was no problem. Staff all very helpful, also the nice Lady at the breakfast-service who knew after two days our room number and what we liked to drink in the morning- and she had a lot of guests to know!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal little hotel”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldmanBrum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed as it is within 15 minutes walk of the Colosseum and is only 5 minutes from the Terminii station. It is not down the side of the station where most of the dingy tourist hotels are but is across from the front amongst various Embassy and Diplomatic buildings. It is a fairly quite neighbourhood although there are a number of reasonable restaurants within a short distance and a few local bars. The rooms are fairly small (Although about average for most central big city rooms) but very clean and well maintained and as you are in Rome you are really only going to be sleeping in them so they are fine. The staff are all very friendly and speak good English, the breakfast is the classic Italian style i.e. loads of cakes and sweet things but accompanied by great coffee! All in all for the price this is an excellent hotel and ideal for a short break in the city

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ANGHARRAD
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my husband and teenage daughter.I endorse all the praise that this site has given the Crosti Hotel.Immaculately clean~ everything worked~ well maintained~ modern fittings~ ideal location for reasonably priced restaurants~ helpful staff~ good breakfast~ excellent decorative order. Would happily recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Rome was very busy so when visiting the Colloseum~ horrendous queues~ suggest purchasing your ticket from the Forum entrance.Much quieter and the ticket gives you access to both sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel: Clean & Friendly - Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mrs_White
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for a short break...Would recommend & stay again...My husband and I stayed in the Crosti Hotel for 4 nights on a birthday break in Rome. This hotel offered everything we needed for a very safe & comfortable stay. Good Value for money, clean spacious room, fresh towels with the room cleaned each day, modern bathroom & shower. TV, Safe, Mini bar / fridge, hairdryer, A/C, room phone. Luggage storgage on departure day. Breakfast was a selection of meats, cheeses, cereals & pastries, tea, coffee & fresh juices - just help yourself!. We walked to all areas of interest except the Vatican & St Peters Bascillica (we used the Metro), if you check the map you are not too far from anything (if you like walking - reach most areas in 20-45 mins - very pleasant & many Bascillicas to visit on the way - these are free of charge just cover shoulders & knees). We paid for the tours (Vatican & Colosseum / Forum) which avoided the long queues & we learnt much more!. Heard some bad reviews about the Termini Station (homeless / pickpockets) thankfully the Hotel is a few streets away so it can be avoided especially at night - although we had no problems or hassle day or night. Hotel will provide information & literature on places to visit. It is only 10 mins from the Termini Station, we used the Terravision bus to get there from the airport approx 30 mins transfer 8 euros rtn. There is a supermarket 5 mins from the Hotel useful for snacks & water (always carry a bottle & fill up from the many water taps around). We really enjoyed our stay & would recommend the Crosti Hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: JoeB-2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti Hotel in June of this year and loved it. We only had a one night stay but it couldn't have been better. It's close to the train station and surrounded by nice restaurants. The older gentelman at the front desk (didn't catch his name) was very helpful in finding a good place to eat and was very friendly. The room was very modern and comfortable. I would recommend this place to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel-request the annex for the best rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dfoglesong1
Reviews.Content: Good location, near metro and bus stops, close to Roma Termini. Very good breakfast as part of room price. A/C failed in one of our two rooms but management moved us to another room. Hotel and rooms are clean and well appointed. Rooms are typically euro small. However, request a room in the annex building a few blocks from the main hotel to get a larger room with a full kitchen. Annex building is even closer to the metro stop. Good grocery store a few blocks away. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed here several times and will again”
Reviews.Author: Manningjen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, unassuming, reasonably priced hotell, the Crosti is a great find. Nothing too fancy, but the staff does everything well. Near Termini train station, but in a nice neighborhood, with several quite good restaurants within a block or two. If you don't have too much luggage, you can walk there from Termini & save yourself taxi fare.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: SASSYMH
Reviews.Content: We were on a Europeann vacation with Rome and the Crosti being the highlight of the trip for me. The hotel was wonderful, clean and spacious. The staff was courteous and very helpful, especially Pietro. He made sure we were well taken of and gave us very personal attention. We also met the owners of the hotel who were equally as gracious. I would never stay anywhere else when in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “STILL SO AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: lancelot68
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Crosti and it still was as amazing as last year. The hotel was secure. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless. The bed was very comfortable and the room itself is spacious enough. The staff is very helpful and friendly, especially Pietro. Ask and you shall receive. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and we'd return”
Reviews.Author: DVilla1710
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crosti. We enjoyed the hotel staff, the amenities, and best of all, the location. Close to the Termini train station and the main bus line yet far enough from the hustle and bustle of the tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “Smart clean room with a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YorkTalk
Reviews.Content: We had a family room for myself my wife and my 13 year old son. The modern room was a decent size with comfortable beds and very clean. 10 min easy walk from Termini Station. The breakfast buffet was better than expected. All of the staff were very friendly and happy to speak English. Used taxis on an evening and reasonably priced at 8 Euros from Piazza Navone in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Crosti ideal for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: arch1960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crosti this weekend. It is ideal for a weekend of sightseeing. Its a easy walk from the Termini, we got the Terravision coach transfer from the airport at a bargain 4 Euros each. We had room 114 overlooking a courtyard, the room was clean - bathroom-had jacuuzi spa bath which didnt work and only 2 jets on the power shower worked.As we were only staying 2 nights we didnt complain and managed quite well with the normal shower.There was a safe in the wardrobe which we used for passports and travel documents.The beds were uncomfortable and the pillows hard. We encountered 3 different male receptionists,2 were very friendly and helpful,1 had an abrupt manner.When we arrived he took all our details,checked us in , then told us to come back in 2 hours as the room wasnt ready. The breakfast was very good,pastries,fruit,bread,meat ,cheese,cakes,eggs,cereal,yoghurts plenty to choose from. We took the open topped bus tour but could have done the same route using the Metro at affraction of the cost. Take a good detailed map with you and you can find all the sights easily from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: AnnandBob99
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome at 6am by air after a 12 hour flight and at the Crosti about 7.30am. The staff were very helpful and offered breakfast and arranged for the housekeeping staff to prepare our room earlier than the standard afternoon checkin. We had access to our clean and comfortable room from 9.00am which was very much appreciated. The hotel is conveniently located to the Termini Station and the "Red Open Topped Tour Bus" which we took to get a "look" at Rome during our one night stay before moving onto country Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: suzette54
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, charming and excellent location. Next to restaurants, grocery store, ATM, and both underground lines, this location can't be beat. Quiet neighborhood with all the things you need. Extremely helpful staff and great breakfast. This was my favorite hotel we stayed in in 3 weeks in Italy. I highly recommend it, and would stay there again without hesitation. Tip: book ahead for airport pick-up at www.airportshuttle.it It was 25 euros for one person, plus 6 euros for 2nd person and well worth it after a red-eye flight from the U.S. So nice to see that driver waiting instead of fighting to catch a train to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JenGregg1217
Reviews.Content: A little off the beatten path of the main attractions. We still walked to everything took any where from 15 min to 30 min. Very close to the termini where you can pick up a subway train to get to the Vatican. The service was very nice and breakfast was just enough. we would stay again if we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it...”
Reviews.Author: drhako
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a double room in this hotel this April. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast that was included was excelent. Everything worked fine, excellent staff - very very friendly It is really an excelent oportunity for the money. We would stay here again the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An Attractive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NordicSun
Reviews.Content: - fast check-in and friendly and helpful staff - simple, clean rooms - good selection of cold meals + special coffees - good location, close to Termini station - a good restaurant/pizzeria nearby - very disappointed with the quality of pizza in ITALY (avoid pizzas close to Termini station). I had the worst one ever in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tryfan
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received was very warm and lots of helpful advice was given.The room was quite large, very clean and well-equipped apart from not having a mirror in the bedroom. Breakfast was excellent - fresh fruit salad, fruit, cereals, yogurt,breads, cheese, meats and lots of wonderful pastries - plenty to sustain you for a day`s sightseeing. Strangely, the hotel does not have wi-fi. The hotel is close to the rail and bus stations and the area was very safe. There are a lot of bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “clean, small room, desk manager not so nice”
Reviews.Author: Todd5712
Reviews.Content: I have only stayed in two hotels in Rome. Both were very small which I assume is the standard for rooms in this price range in Rome. The room was VERY clean and serviceable. Nothing fancy here. The had two beds, a closet, desk, and TV. Bathroom was clean and newer. Internet was 3 Euro for 24 hours. Get cable from front desk. The breakfast was good. The only complaint was with the front desk. Not so nice. Not mean or nasty. Just felt like I was bothering them when I talked to them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near Termini. Excelent for the money. A hidden jewel.”
Reviews.Author: Viajero049
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a double room in this hotel. Everything was excelent. The hotel is really great. It´s new, the rooms are big and clean. Everything worked fine, the bathroom is very modern and huge. It is really an excelent oportunity for the money. The hotel is 5 blocks from termini. The area is safe including at night. Also the breakfast was perfect. I recommend it for every one. Great area, great hotel, great price. I would come back no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eftapsichos
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet, polite personnel , spaceous rooms, delicious & fresh buffet for breakfast.Located in beteween 2 metro stations (6-10 min walking distance) 1 bus stop (3 min walking distance.)When we booked we were worried about no negative opinions.Now its obvious that there are not any negatives to say.Reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KevF2418
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crosti Hotel during February 2011. The room was massive and very clean. Breakfast was nice and the hotel is close to the Termini station so getting there from the airport wasn't a problem. Close to metro stations that take you to the Vatican, Colosseum, Spanish Steps and many of the major sites. Brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel_whoohoo
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 10 a.m. and the rooms were not ready so they had us leave the luggage in the lobby. We went to eat breakfast and were slightly disturbed seeing our baggage still accessible to anyone in the lobby when we came back but nothing was missing. Rooms are simple and functional. Showers were small. Bidet, good blow dryer, and towel warmer present. Bed was comfortable although slightly firm for me. They gave us power adapters to use during our stay. Good location about a 15-20 minute walk to Trevi fountain and 30 minutes to the forum. We loved walking everywhere to take in the sights. Breakfast included was pretty good - pastries, frittata, boiled eggs, croissants, rolls, two cheeses and deli meats, cereal. Coffee was so delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super staff!”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Crosti Hotel for 2 nights and we are completely thrilled by their service. Crosti is a definite must for tourists. It is located 10 mins away from Termini station, conveniently close to the station to make it easier in exploring the city. Room is clean enough and bathroom is in adequate size. Towels, amenities are provided. Bed is comfortable too. Breakfast is included and it is good to kick off a day. We are very impressed with the staff. The reception is very friendly, he took us to our room, he even carried our luggage to the room. A very warm welcome to us after a long trip. He explained to us how to explore the city and at one night we were quite hungry and looking for a good decent Italian restaurant, the reception told us to go to one restaurant a few blocks away from the hotel. We tried it and completely satisfied with his choice. A very Italian dining experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Leeny3112
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here after reading tripadvisors reviews - and it was just as advertised. Nice hotel close to the Termini! We came in by train from Paris and it was very easy to walk to from the termini station. The rooms were good sized and comfortable. The bed was comfortable after a long day exploring the city. The front desk was helpful in suggesting how to get around the city. Our italian is poor so we we're very thankful that the everyone spoke good english. The only drawback is that the hotel is a good walk away from the main tourist attractions. As long as you are ok walking a bit, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Crosti Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crosti Hotel from Dec. 26th – 30th. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful in booking our tickets to a museum and providing directions to the various sites in Rome. We also communicated with the receptionist several times by email before our arrival and we received immediate replies regarding our inquiries. We booked a single room, which was small, but it was very clean and modern with a flat screen tv, refrigerator, safe, and newly remodeled bathroom. The shower was very small, but we assume this may be standard for some European hotels. The bed linens seemed new and the housekeeping service was great. The room did not include an alarm clock/radio or ironing board/iron, but this was not a problem for us. The breakfast room was pleasant with a very nice selection of food, and the staff was very friendly and offered quick service – we looked forward to breakfast each morning! We also used the hotel’s taxi service both ways to the airport and recommend this as a form of transportation, as it was reliable and timely for our pick up to and from the airport. We thought that the hotel was located in a safe section of Rome and did not encounter any problems. If you are fine with walking, many of the sites are easily accessible by foot, and there are a few restaurants very close to the hotel. For staying over the holidays, our room rate was excellent at 95 euros for the first few nights and there was a slight increase for the last nights due to the New Year’s holiday, but the rate was a bargain regardless of the slight increase. If we visit Rome again, we would definitely stay at this hotel, and we recommend it to family and friends if they are looking for a nice place to rest at night but without major amenities – thank you Crosti Hotel for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simple Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: lancelot68
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 2 and a half years old. It is new, very clean and superb service. The concierge, Pietro, is wonderful. He gives suggestions on restaurants and spots to visit. It takes about 8-10 minutes (walking) to get to the closest Metro Station (Castro Pretorio) and a 20-min walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Other than the hotel not being that close to the famous tourist spots, it is an amazing hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, just perfect for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: Khbrown04
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Crosti Hotel for a six-night stay. We were greeted by very polite staff. The room was small, but it was clean, comfortable and a great place to return to at the end of a long day of sightseeing. The staff scheduled all of our tours, even our return shuttle to the airport. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, and it was an excellent continental breakfast with plenty of choices, including fresh fruits. I would return to this hotel any time I return to Rome because it was in a good location, felt safe, and had exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: NYCnative76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in early December and was pleased with the hotel. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was quite nice for a European hotel. The room was on the larger side for Rome and had a shower with an actual door that closed (none of the other places I stayed at in Italy had one) and a real blowdryer, not the awful 50's versions that blow cold hair that a lot of others have. My only complaints were that theer was no wi-fi and the safe in the room didn't work. But I'd definitely consider staying here again. For $63 Euros, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “excellent valuehotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: thebuckers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for long weekend with wife and two adult daughters. 10 minute walk from Termini, Repubblica & Castro Pretorio stations. Room very comfortable with large bed,use of fridge & safe and modern bathroom. Excellent continental breakfast with great of food & service. All hotel staff were pleasant, efficient and extremely helpful. No complaints at all. A great choice in a safe location with many restaurants and attractions close by.

Reviews.Title: “Crosti Hotel - Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: fiona_oliver
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Crosti Hotel with my 16year old daughter for a special weekend in Rome. We had a great weekend, we were very comfortable in the hotel which is in a good location, close to the centre but not too noisy. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was delicious. Best of all, after we had a problem with the shuttle bus to the airport on the way home and incurred additional travel expenses, Signor Crosti personally made sure that we were compensated for the extra expenses. I would definitely stay at Crosti Hotel again and will recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not far from Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: DCH47
Reviews.Content: The Crosti is a nice hotel about eight blocks from the main train station (termini). We stayed there both before and after a cruise out of Civitavecchia. There is a metro stop for both subway lines at the train staton, so the location was convenient. We walked with our luggage once because of the long line for a taxi, but it wasn't particularly easy due to the uneven pavement and the fact that we had a lot of bags. With no luggage it's an easy walk to the train station. There are plenty of restaurants right around the hotel as well as in the train station, so finding a place to eat was not a problem. I was traveling with my wife and adult son and our room was something like a suite, with twin beds in one room and a single bed and sofa in an adjoining room. The bathroom had a toilet, small shower, and sink and there was also a separate toilet. We found it somewhat strange that both toilets were off the same room, with no toilet in the "master bedroom" but this wasn't really a problem. The furnishings were somewhat spartan, but we had everything we needed. There was a locked door between the hallway and the group of three or four rooms our room was in and of course a lock to our door as well, so we felt quite secure. The hotel was quiet despite being right on the street because we closed the wooden louvered shutters and windows; if you want to sleep with the windows open, you might find the street noise bothersome. We were there in late October and the management decided that we would need heat instead of air conditioning. Our room was a little warm for us, so they turned off the heat but could not turn on the air conditioner. We cooled the room down by opening the windows before bed and it was comfortable enough. The staff was helpful and efficient. A nice breakfast buffet was included and we got 24 hours of internet for three Euro. We had our own computer ... no computers were available at the hotel, but there is a very inexpensive internet cafe between the hotel and train station. We had heard people recommend not staying by the train starion, but we had no problems and liked the convenience since we took the train to and from the cruise port and used the metro a lot. Overall this was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal moderately priced hotel for the Rome tourist”
Reviews.Author: Woodbine13
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Rome's Ciampino airport and used the efficient pre-booked Terravision bus to Rome Termini. It was then only about 600 yards to the Crosti. We were greeted at reception by a helpful and efficient person who supplied us with a map of central Rome and pointed out to us the various well known sites and their location in relation to the hotel. He also gave us information about using the local city transport passes. Continental breakfast is provided between 7am and 10am, cold food only but good quality and plenty to choose from. The room was a good size with a large comfortable bed and ample wardrobe. The bathroom had a shower but no bath. Everything in the room and hotel was immaculately clean. Overall the hotel was excellent and in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Moden Hotel, some noise in the evening”
Reviews.Author: Claire25286
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Crosti, Rome between 15th and 18th October 2010. On arrival we were greeted by a very friendly gentleman behind the recption desk. He checked us in and asked for another member of staff to take us and our luggage to our room. He also recommended a lovely restaurant at the end of the road that the hotel was on that the hotel also ran. We decided to go to the restaurant on our first evening and the food was superb. My partner had the steak and I had a pasta dish but the full menu looked lovely. The hotel room itself was very modern with a flat screen TV on the wall and bright and airy with high ceilings. I feel in love with the windows which opened fully and had shutters which drowned out almost all of the noise from the street in the evening and made the room very dark to enable a good nights sleep. The breakfast was continental with the usual bread, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt etc which was nice but you can't beat a hot breakfast i.e eggs on toast. Obviously you would be able to visit a cafe nearby that had more options but the breakfast at the hotel was adequate. The hotel staff were very friendly and even loaned is an adaptor for the plugs (as I had brough the wrong one!). Overall I would recommend the Crosti for people of all ages whether a couple or a family with young children as it is within a 5/7 minute walking distance to the Termini (central) Station and a 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain as well as being clean and modern with helpful staff. p.s. Rome is a very romantic city and brings out the best in people as I witnessed when my partner of 6 years proposed to me during our trip there :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend- Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Lburitica
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing area and great advice from the front desk (Germano) who directed us to the best places to eat, entertainment and site seeing. Easy access to everything by the Metro but also if you love to walk, you can stumble upon all different piazzas that have everything you need- shopping, site seeing, amazing gelato, food etc etc. Did not have any trouble at all with the language barrier, there are english menus available just about every restaurant and English options for ATMs and Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value - book here!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravels61
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Crosti Hotel was everything we expected, and more! The location was superb, a 10 min walk to the Termini and subway. The room was large, clean, and very comfortable. When making our reservation, Giovanni and Pietro were extremely helpful and promt in making arrangements for our travel from the airport to the hotel. Upon arrival, the staff was very helpful with recommending restaurants in the area and directing us to the metro and bus stations. The breakfast was wonderful with a great international variety. The Italian coffee latte was the best coffee we had all around Italy! I will go back again and would highly recommend this hotel as it is a gem at an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel- a place to return to again.”
Reviews.Author: PaulBarrett98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti hotel for 3 nights. We selected the accommodation on the basis of previous recommendations on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. From the moment of arrival to our departure we were made to feel very welcome by all the staff who were keen to help and advise. The room was clean and well appointed with air conditioning and a view on to a side street. The Breakfast buffet superseded anything one would normally expect in Italy where brakfast usually consists of a hurried pastry and coffee (in fact similar to our own breakfasts back home) . At Crosti we were treated to a selection of meats, frittata, eggs, breads and pastries. We are not big breakfasters but managed 3 pastries between us. To wash it down there were freshly squeezed juices, coffee(including cappucino) or tea. Crosti is situated close to Termini railway station with metro and bus links into central Rome. We used these but also found it to be comfortable walking distance from most of the key tourist sites. Despite what you read Termini and its environs were lively but not threatening. There are the usual problems that you expect to find at any large railway station but we never felt in danger and liked the atmosphere here more than some of the more rarified areas. The surrounding roads were noisy - this includes throughout the night with revellers, rubbish carts, delivery trucks and irrascible scooterists. This is a problem throughout Rome and much of the noise can be reduced by use of the shutters and double glazed windows although we prefer to let the night air (and sounds) pervade our room. The area is well served with eateries- La Famiglia is popular with locals and San Vincenzo close by is owned by the hotel proprietors- this was good especially for fish and guests enjoy a 10% discount We would certainly return to Crosti again on a further visit.

Reviews.Title: “Crosti Hotel - a perfect beginning to our Med vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kanucks
Reviews.Content: Our group of 8 stayed in 4 rooms which were all different from each other but spotless, comfortable and affordable. Many thanks to Giovanni who answered my emails promptly and arranged transportation from the airport for us at a reasonable cost. We were orginally going to take the train but because the price was so good we decided to take the private pickup instead. Two vans were waiting for us when we landed and shortly we arrived at the Crosti. Even though it was only 10:30 a.m., 2 of our rooms were ready and the other 2 were available within the hour. Giovanni recommended a local place for pizza which we enjoyed before leaving for our tour of the Vatican. That evening we ate a couple of blocks away at Vincenzo's (the owner of the Crosti). We had a great meal and some local wine for a very good price. The next morning we had a buffet breakfast included in the price of the room and it was a perfect start to our day of sightseeing. We will definitely stay at the Crosti again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel handy for Termini”
Reviews.Author: Greatajp
