Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel about a 10 minute walk from Termini agree with comments made by other useres breakfast good and easy to access city via Metro Systyem got the 3 day 11 euro tourist ticket a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Crosti Hotel was a Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: jhoffmann
Reviews.Content: I don’t have enough good things to say about the Crosti Hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Each and every member of the staff that our party of seven came in contact with was friendly, knowledgeable, and very courteous. We asked for restaurant recommendations, and got them. (The Restarante Famiglia close to the Hotel was absolutely GREAT!) Our rooms were quite large, very clean, attractive, and comfortable. The bed was overly firm by American standards, as were the pillows, but that’s a small distraction considering all the wonderful pluses. The hotel was easy to find from Termini Station and is only about 6 blocks away. The hotel provides easy access to two metro stations, with the one at the Termini Station being more crowded, but giving one access to both Lines A & B. The hotel is within walking distance of several sites, and a very short metro ride from most. The breakfast was plentiful, varied, delicious. All kinds of cold cuts, cheeses, bread, rolls, croissants, were available; juices, milk, cereal, fresh fruit, jams, etc. Coffee and cappuccino Italian style was wonderful. Compared to hundreds of other hotels considered for our stay in Rome, the Crosti Hotel and its staff are unquestionably the best value we could have hoped for. By the end of our stay, we had come to consider Crosti Hotel a home away from home. Have no doubt, when we return to Rome, this is the hotel we will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast, wonderful staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: may_and_morb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights with my partner - first time to Rome. Easy walking distance from the main station (can't remember the name of it now) Outside is lit up and looks lovely. The guy at the desk was fantastic, gave us a map of Rome, circled all the famous spots and added in a few suggestions of his own that the 'young kids' like to go to. Bathroom was spotless which is such a high priority for me. Bed was big and comfortable. The breakfast each morning was a treat!. Fritatta and cold meats and breads, fruit, cereals and great coffee. The big creamy desserts were a bit odd for breakkie but hey, you're on holiday!! Booked through the hotel website and got it for slightly cheaper than those expedia/last minute sities. Walking distance to most things or there are train stations around if you cant be bothered. Loved it, Wouldnt hesitate to recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: CndnTraveller
Reviews.Content: Being in Europe many times and staying in Rome alone several times - this hotel is a treasure. Recently renovated, spotless with a good room size and the price asked - you will have a great value for your money. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful, guys at reception are very helpfull. Basically, I highly recommend this hotel. The only thing I could say against is a tiny elevator (fit for 2 people without bags) and a small shower cabin in the bathroom - which however is of a standard size. I am sure you will enjoy your stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: CheshireChallenger
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, great location to reach all sites. The entire Hotel was spotlessly clean, our room provided good storage, good bed with lovely linen. The ensuite facility was excellent with a powerful shower and lovely white thick towels changed daily. We appreciated the safe deposit box and mini bar in room. The breakfast was plentiful and provided the biggest choice of any continental breakfast we had encountered and was served by a lovely lady. All staff were friendly from our initial welcome to when we left at the end of our week's stay. The reception staff, in particular Germano and Pietro, who were always pleasant and helpful with directions and recommending restaurants. We particularly enjoyed the Da Vincenzo where both the food and service was excellent. We also enjoyed other restaurants nearby - namely Monte Arci and Andreas. In particular we must mention Bar Montebello exactly opposite the Crosti - a lovely friendly place where we ended each evening with a coffee and liquor. We felt quite safe in the area even late at night. The sites are wonderful but do visit Campo Fiori flower and vegetable markets, cross the river and view Travestere which is more peaceful and local. We walked everywhere (using the map) and soon familiarised ourselves with the locality. Would recommend using the Hotel to book a Taxi direct to the Airport. So quick and easy and only a few euros more than using the train.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Mcrooo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in two of their apartments for two nights. Their apartments were extremely clean. Special thanks to the wonderful cleaning lady, Claudia. Just like home, equipped with a clean bathroom, full kitchen, a washing machine, a flat-screen tv…etc Breakfast was great but had to walk a few blocks from the apartment. Located within a 5 minutes walk from metro station (castro pretorio) or a 10 minutes walk from Roma Termini. A hidden gem in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough away...”
Reviews.Author: bombakid
Reviews.Content: As the taxi driver drove up to the Crosti, we felt that we had just passed much of Rome's finest tourist spots to find ourselves tucked away in a small and quaint hotel. Walking in, you enter a small lobby that is ideally European. It is equipped with knowledgeable staff sitting behind a small desk and little else. But, we can see the lower breakfast area that soon will feature a good breakfast for us in the morning. One that features eggs, processed meats (not my favourite), cereals and sweets. Going into the room, we have a regular card-key that gets scanned to let us in. The room features a large armoir, drawer space and the safe. The window can open and we can see outside, but would rather not. The view is of the back alley and nothing more. The washroom is of a good size, especially considering that European bathrooms are considerably small usually. A great shower with strong water pressure and a heated rack to hang our towels. This was a great 'old school' add-on. The bed was the highlight, it was firm and comfortable. Going to sleep on the other hand was interesting. Upon closing the lights, we realize that the card slot (where the room card is placed when entering to turn on the electricity) emits these blue lights that are so strong when closing the lights. It turned into a strange club 54 atmosphere. I needed a sock to put over the card to hide these lights. They were incredibly bright. The location was what drew us to the Crosti, it is close to the train station. Surprisingly enough, the Crosti provides a great end point when done sight-seeing. Starting from the Colosseum, one can walk to all the main sights in almost a straight line and walk all the way back to the hotel. We caught all of the sights at night this time and really enjoyed the walks back, it felt comfortable and safe. There is a supermarket close, but we never utilized it. Other than that, restaurants are available in the entire city, seemingly within ten steps of each other. Nothing of major note is really around the hotel other than that. The Crosti is a good hotel when you don't need to be be so close to all of the main sights. It allows you to enjoy a nice stroll through the city, especially in a city where every corner is a picture perfect moment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tbrich
Reviews.Content: The Crostil Hotel in Rome on the street, "Via Castelfidardo," was a great hotel. It was clean and about a 30 minute walk to Ancient Rome. As a solo traveler, I felt safe. The breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly. They were helpful with any questions I have and went above and above and beyond to make sure I was taken care of with any requests I had. Pietro at the front desk was especially friendly, accomdating and always helped me out with anything I needed. I would definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely nice stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: sunny72
Reviews.Content: Very easy to reach the main sightseeings in Rome . A walkable distance( about 15 min)to Borghese Gallery (don't forget to make a reservation for this gallery better before arriving,the kindly staff of a hotel will help you on this) Hotel's rooms are big and clean , the breakfast is ok (may be if to enlarge menu with olives and white cheese it will be perfect ). The Owners also has an restaurant which is my family also enjoyed a lot . I will be very glad to have an opportunity to stay in this hotel again. And I definitely reccomend this hotel to my relatives and friends .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-located comfortable, clean, great value -- Hotel Crosti in Rome”
Reviews.Author: maxfelger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Crosti for four days in August 2010 over three visits (upon arrival in Rome, after a Venice trip and after our cruise). Each time, we had a different room in the Hotel Crosti's nearby apartment hotel. Each room was fabulous -- clean, large, recently renovated, comfortable, with a lovely, large terrace and even a fridge, stove, dishwasher and washing machine. The hotel is within easy walking distance -- even towing suitcases -- to Termini train station, and it is one block from a Metro stop, making access to anywhere in the city very easy (though it's not a long walk to anything either). The hotel staff (reception, chambermaid, breakfast servers) were all very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend the Crosti hotel and we thank them for helping to make our stay(s) in Rome great. Wifi is available for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: DaniBug
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Crosti early July with husband. Upon arrival - reception staff were immediately very pleasant and helpful - we were offered free upgrade to the 2 bedroom apartment owned by the hotel around the corner. Apartment was really lovely and really well-equipped and clean as a whistle. Very large terraced area to sit out in t he morning and watch the swifts! On 8th floor of a beautiful house but thankfully had a lift! Breakfast very nice too. Great location to see all the sights of wonderful Rome. Already planning to go back next Auturm (this time with kids) and will try and book the wonderful apartment at the Crosti. Beware though - Rome is July is boiling hot - not ideal for tramping around the streets of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: K1000M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti Hotel for a long weekend. Located about 10mins from Termini station meaning excellent transport links - metro & buses or about 15/20mins walk from the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed on a low floor due to taking our 6 month old son. Room was spacious with large double bed and cot. Bathroom was also very spacious and very modern. Air con was fantastic after a long hot day in the city. Neighbourhood was nice and we felt safe even in the evening, a few restaurants near by - definately recommend the Da Vincenzo that is run by the hoteliers family - very good food for fantastic value - discount for staying at the hotel. Breakfast consisted of pastries, cheeses, cold meats, fruit, cakes etc. Would highly recommend this hotel, fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in oustanding location, best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EPLFan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Crosti is a lovely little hotel that is off the beaten path, but just by a block or two. It is close to the action without being in the middle of all kinds of noisy goings on. It is an easy walk to the train station, even schlepping luggage. Of course, there are cabs galore, if you prefer. The staff is absolutely top-notch, five star. Unfortunately the breakfast and wait-staff are so wonderful that my family spent the next three weeks measuring all other experiences against Crosti. Nothing compared. The rooms are small but nice. You may have to navigate a step inside your room, fyi. There is a lift for folks who need one. Elevators, i our experience, are not a given. Great hotel and the perfect choice for our family. HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: citybreak007
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The location is perfect (only 4-5min walk to Castro Pretorio metro and 'walkable' to all attractions within whole city if this is what you prefer - this is what we like to do!!), the decor is lovely and the service is great. The breakfast, in particular, is worthy of praise. We have visited Rome 3 times over the past few years and this is, by far, the best hotel we have stayed in. I'm sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Katerina11
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Crosti Hotel Apartments for 5 nights in July and they were exactly what we needed! Great location as it was less than a 5 minute walk from Castro Pretorio metro station, giving us a great base for getting around Rome. The apartment we had was on the 6th floor and included a large bathroom with a shower and washing machine, a bedroom with a large double bed and plentiful wardrobe space with a safe at no extra charge and a kitchen/living room with a fridge-freezer, microwave, dishwasher and espresso machine. We had also had a terrace which was nice to spend the evening if we weren't out for a meal and there was also air-conditioning for when it got too hot, which it definitely did! Overall the apartments were great and the breakfast included in our rate was very good with coffee or tea and the usual breads, cheeses, fruits, cereal etc. The rooms were cleaned daily and towels were replaced. Would recommend this to anyone who needs a good place to explore Rome from! The hotel also give you a 10% discount at their partner restaurant 'de Vicenzo' which served great food and reasonably price (even without the discount).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base - transport and restaurants close by”
Reviews.Author: r00m_with_a_view
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti for 4 nights in June taking recommended reviews on Trip Advisor. - an excellent choice. The hotel is a short walk from Termini in a quiet area with restaurants close by, there is also a bus stop at the end of the street and then turn left ,with buses that go to all the "must see " sights. Our very large room overlooked a small courtyard so it was very quiet at night so much so that we were able to leave off the air conditioning and leave the window open. Fridge and safe (no charge) The modern bathroom was amazing with a full Jacucci bath and an over the bath Jacuzzi shower with jets . Fresh towels every day. The breakfast was fantastic - croissants, rolls, bread, jam, cheeses, hams, boiled eggs, a type of cold omelette, fresh fruit, yogurt , fruit juices, Danish pastries, cake and various cereals. Amazing !!! The front staff were knowledgeable and very courteous . An excellent hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Bravo - You Won't be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Huskerluv
Reviews.Content: My Mother, brother and I stayed at the Crosti for 4 nights in June 2010. All of the Trip Advisor reviews were on target. You will not be disappointed with the Crosti Hotel. The hotel is a short 6 - 7 walk to Termini station, where you can catch the subway, train or tour bus. Mapquest the location before leaving home and you'll have no trouble finding it. Safe area. Grocery store is a block or so away for snacks, wine and necessities. The breakfast (included) was delicious and filling. The rooms were very very clean, quiet, and decorated nicely. The bathrooms have updated ammenities with granite or marble and are very nice. The hotel staff was accommodating, suggested tours and graciously stored luggage on our last day so we could enjoy final sights of Rome before hopping onto a night train to Germany. Fantastic value. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: rachcanb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Crosti hotel appartments with my two children. The staff were so helpful and friendly. Great locaton. We enjoyed having our own private terrace, where we sat outside and ate pizza. There's also a washing machine a must with kids. The air condioning also worked really well, important when it's 38 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't realise it would be so good”
Reviews.Author: Anna73784
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel that i stayed in in Rome. The first one was fine but this one was just fantastic. The room we stayed in was more like a small appartment and the bathroom was equally as spacious. The staff were nice and helpful when we arrived early to drop off our luggage and when we asked them to suggest a place to eat. It was located a few streets away from a train station and it wasn't difficult to walked to the sites. Im not exactly sure how much we payed, however i can say without a doubt i would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel in Rome, good value”
Reviews.Author: von403
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Crosti for 4 nights in June with my family, and we have enjoyed our stay very much, The hotel is located not far from the Termini station, so its very easy to get around Rome by metro. The rooms are good size and very clean. The staffs are very nice and friendly, especially the receptionist Pietro, he is very very helpful. All in all very good value for the money I have paid for the rooms, I booked the rooms on the hotel's own website, where I believe you can get the cheapest rate. I would love to stay there again if I'm going back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: BornTraveling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Crosti was one of our favorite hotels from our 2 weeks in Italy. The breakfast buffet had much variety from other breakfasts. The bathroom was huge, and the bedroom, while not spacious, was well decorated (no mirror in the bedroom, however). We were able to use the hotel's laptop for an extremely reasonable rate (2 euros for 6 hours). When the hotel said they'd mail our postcards, my husband remarked that it was nice to have a full-service hotel at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pietro & Giovanni- magnificent”
Reviews.Author: LabLight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crosti for 2 nights while awaiting a Mediterranean cruise and again on our return for 2 days. The hotel is situated in walking distance to the Termini which offers fast and economical transportation via train to the Port. The staff are fabulous from the hard working waitress in the morning breakfast buffet to to the desk staff. Pietro and Giovanni are both amazing and assisted us with all our trips we wanted to undertake while in Rome and with wine openers, ice, internet connections ( very cheap) etc. The rooms are small, but clean with upgraded bathrooms and equipment, including safes. Air Conditioning was a pleasure as it was very warm in Rome. There is a market very close by where you can purchase wine, beer, groceries and snacks, etc. We spent most of our time out of the hotel on tours & adventures but when we returned tired, the staff and rooms were a welcoming site. p.s Take the "Top Bike rental" tour of Rome, 4.5 hrs of a good workout and really impressive tour host and also any of the the "Eden Walks tours; top notch tour guides. Crosti very much recommended for this price range. S&N Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, attractive, clean with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jhawksworth
Reviews.Content: Travelled with husband and a couple of friends - we arranged for a private car pick up from the airport by email a couple of days before our trip - used mudicars and travelled in a mercedes direct to the hotel for 50 euros which is cheaper than 4 train tickets at 14 euros each from Fiumicino to Termini station. Our lady driver was a typically Italian driver so it was sometimes a bit heart-stopping but we survived and got to the hotel at 2 pm and were shown straight to our rooms. One was slightly bigger and had a very spacious bathroom with jacuzzi bath and shower - the other was smaller and only had a shower in the bathroom. Rooms were serviced every day with fresh towels and toiletries supplied - also free use of a safe in the room. Breakfast was very good, fruit juices, fresh fruit, ham cheese, frittata, boiled eggs, bread rolls, croissants and several types of cake to choose from. There are several reastaurants on the street and we tried Da Vincenzo where you get 10% off your bill, The Steak House and Da Andrea - we were quite happy with all of them but the fillet steak at Vincnezo's was excellent. The hotel is only a ten minute walk from the hop on, hop off tour bus and we bought a 2 day ticket for 18 euros each as it's a good way to see what's on offer, get your bearings and choose what you want to go back to. With the world cup in full swing Pietro at the hotel arranged for us to see the England match on Wednesday by reserving a table for us at a bar with a giant screen. I could go on about our trip but that would be boring for you, however if we ever return to rome will definitely choose the Crosti again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! good location”
Reviews.Author: travelersmoncton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Crosti two nights early in May. It was clean and well located. There were quite a few restaurants on the street, so we felt very secure going out in the evening for dinner. For wine lovers, there is a great wine store "Trimani", just a short walk from the hotel. The breakfasts were very good. We especially want to express our appreciation for Germano, the evening desk clerk. He was most friendly and very helpful. It was easy to walk to the train station and the metro as well. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a good location”
Reviews.Author: floatysheep
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Crosti hotel in May for 3 nights. We were happily surprised that the hotel was such a clean, comfortable place. The hotel is a walkable distance from Termini station, although we found it a challenge trying to find the hotel with luggage. We were greeted warmly and were shown to our room which was not spacious but adequate and very clean. The bathroom was lovely with a power show, toiletries and plenty of towels. We had air con, a safe and a little fridge in our room which was very handy. The breakfast was a fantastic start to the day and included fresh coffee, juices, cereals, breads, cakes, croissants, cheeses fruit and yogurt. The staff were very welcoming and happy to help show us where to go to certain places around Rome. All in all it was a fantastic stay and i would happily return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: baybob1
Reviews.Content: I, my brother, and his wife were there for four nights in early May. The rooms were comfortable and recently remodeled, including sound proof windows. The breakfast is very well done. Germano, you gave us outstanding service, including helping us arrange a wonderful last minute trip to Montepulciano. Bob, La Crosse WI USA

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Crosti”
Reviews.Author: Ktowndoodles
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to go to the Crosti Hotel for a 3 day stay in Rome. We were travelling by train and the hotel is a mere 10/15 minute walk from the train station, which is incredibly handy! Despite it's closeness to the train station (generally not the best areas), the hotel is in a calm and elegant neighbourhood. The reception is excellent, all the employees are lovely. The room was very good, irreprochable, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. As we walked all day in Rome, a good breakfast was indispensable and I must say the Crosti did not decive. (toast, eggs, various pastries, cakes, yogurt, fresh fruit, dried fruit, coffe and tea,...) The one thing I would definetly not recommend though is the restaurant that belongs to the same owners as the hotel's. The pasta was barley cooed, bathing in fat. It is recommended by the hotel, but I really hated it (and I'm not difficult food-wise) All in all, a lovely place to stay for a relaxing time in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Lynlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights before a cruise. It is close to Termini station which makes it convienient to get from the airport and train to cruise terminal. While I am sure there are more central hotels, the rates for what you get are hard to beat and the subway is not far either. The room had a little fridge which was nice, and there were some really nice markets around the area to get wonderful self catering meals (ie cheeses, meats, salads, greens) as well as cafes for coffees. The room was spotless. the only thing I recommend when booking is to avoid the first floor (where we were). The floors were marble and there was shoe noise, and sometimes voices from the lobby and the street. I assume the upper floors did not have marble floors. The included breakfast was outstanding. Meats, cheese, sweets ( I did not try those) . WHEN (there is no "if" I hope) we return to Rome we will return to Crosti if available.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: WestLancashireBaz
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel to stay in. The room was excellent even had a jet power shower and jacuzzi bath. The staff were always smiling and helpful, in particular the duty receptionist, Pietro. He was a fountain of knowledge and knew all the best local restaurants. The breakfast was a delight, a graet choice, but no hot English type food, which made it healthy.A ten minute walk from Termini train station was ideal. We arrived by train from Rome's main airport and after a 35 minute journey landed at Termini. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “jewel of rome”
Reviews.Author: ammary
Reviews.Content: The Crosti hotel was the highlight of our silver anniversary trip to Rome. The staff are very helpful when you check in and with booking tours, the Roma pass and the breakfasts are very nice. I would definately recommend the Roma pass, just for bypassing the queues to the Colosseum. If you go in the spring as we did, dont wear vest tops as I got sunburn on the open top bus tour and you need to cover your shoulders and knees for the Vatican tours and the churches.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't sure, but it actually turned out to be a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Shaw11946
Reviews.Content: The Crosti is very near the train station, which is convenient, but it's not necessarily the most beautiful area of Rome. (And, honestly, the Metro system in Rome leaves a lot to be desired, so it's not terribly helpful to be so close to the station.) The building is nondescript. The cab drivers didn't even seem to know where it was. Our first impression was...worrisome. But, in fact, the Crosti is a nice choice, a family operation and a comfortable option. We stayed three nights, and it was a great experience. The location did, in fact, turn out to be quite convenient--the neighborhood has some nice restaurants (including one run by the same family that runs the hotel--quite good, and you get a discount) and a couple of lovely squares. The staff of the Crosti was really great, very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of hotels in Rome that are more posh. Many are in the midst of the amazing sights. But this is a nice, comfortable hotel choice for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: floridasailor
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Rome since 1966 The Crosti is the best value for the money In Rome...dot...amen...period. Family run, everybody helpful and everything works which is saying a lot for Rome.. Great breakfast. We stayed at the apts..Mike Conway...St. Petersbur,FL

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: JenLaaks
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after a very long flight from Australia after which Emirates left our bags in Dubai... So we really needed a smooth check in & some rest. And we got exactly that! The man working the front counter was very nice, funny & helpful. We only stayed a couple of nights but it was very nice. Quiet & comfortable with a good bathroom. Breakfast was included and they had a great variety & it was all fresh & tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: laliz5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Crosti for three nights. The hotel itself was nice; the gentlemen in the lobby were friendly, everything was clean, the room was nice and spacious enough, the breakfast was good. My complaint is the neighborhood. It wasn’t terrible but it’s the least safe I felt during our three week trip to Europe. It could have also been Rome itself, overall I didn’t feel that safe there, but it was especially walking back to the hotel that I felt uneasy. We are two 25 and 32 year old women, and we took the metro everywhere. Nothing happened to us, but I did not feel safe coming home to the hotel at night from the metro. It was dark and a few people were lingering around the streets, we got a few cat calls, etc. Daytime was perfectly fine but the night was a different story. For these reasons I would not stay there again. The hotel is not at fault at all, it’s just the area. I’d find somewhere else to stay if you’re visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value !”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Crosti Hotel's apartments (5 mins walk from the hotel). The staff on arrival were excellent. When we got the apartment, we could not believe how clean and modern the place was. Everything you need is there, and it was also cleaned on a daily basis. The location is ideal for those looking for some peace and quiet, whilst still being able to access central Rome. There are a few reasonably priced resturants in the local area (The Steak House nr the hotel was our favourite). For the active person, the walk to central rome is 30 mins. However, there is also a Metro station just round the corner. All in all, a fantastic hotel and apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hallybally
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and is clean and the staff are friendly. It is in a good location witha 10 min walk to Termini Station. Which is the main station where the train stops from the airport (11 Euros). The Breakfast was nice and the room was great. We had a slight problem in that we were located on the ground floor and heard a bit of noice from people talking and answering the phone in reception. Its all tiled so it echoed. We asked if we could move to a higher floor and the staff did this no problem. There is no tea and coffee in room and was not a problem for us but some people may think so. Supermarket just round corner if needed and plenty of restaurants around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, modern, secure, excellent hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TnLManchester
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a fantastic weekend in Rome and the hotel crosti staff made it all the more enjoyable with their knowledge of rome, the places to visit, places to eat and drink and how to get about. The hotel itself is extremely clean and modern. Our room was quiet and even had a jacuzzi bath and power shower which was very welcome after a day walking around the eternal city. It is 10 mins walk from the main termini station and metro and although we used both rome is best explored by foot. The maps make it look larger than it is, 25 mins walk from the hotel to the colloseum with lots of things to explore along the way. Highlights included the view from the very top of Monument to Victor Emmanuel II, go as high as you can, walk around the back and for 7 euros take the glass lift to the top for views across the city. St Peters basillica is amazing and the spanish steps is great for relaxing and people watching. We also had a great hour exploring the Villa Borghese park by motorised tandem, a great way to get around the park in the sunshine. Trying to fault the hotel and rome is hard but if i was to nit-pick, no tea or coffee or iron in the hotel room, be wary of 'helpful people' at the airport, train station and outside the metro stations, they are very friendly but they are all on the make and will tell you anything to try to get you to buy a guided tour or their private transport. And finally, if you're eating out the more upmarket the resturant the cleaner the toilets!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: linzie525
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, good location for trains and also for the area where the tour buses leave from, lots of great places to eat nearby, the room wa amaculate and the bathroom was really big. The beds where good as they had sheets for when it was still warm but a blanket on as well when it started to get cold. Their Breakfast was great and the staff where all really helpful, my mum is unable to eat gluten and the staff were really helpful at providing bread and things that were Gluten free, A Great find this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rach117
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in December before starting a tour. It was really great value given how expensive hotels in Rome can be. The rooms are modern and clean and the staff are very helpful. The hotel isn't far from Termini which was great as I caught the shuttle bus to termini from the airport. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, and rooms”
Reviews.Author: discostu0
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. We were given a free upgrade to apartment suites, which is large compared to most hotels in Europe. The apartment suite is in a separate building 3 minutes away. The room was cleaned well every day. Some of the suites have a washing machine too but you probably have to ask for it. There's a grocery store 2 minutes away from both the main hotel and the suites. The only complaint might be that sound proofing isn't the best as we can hear the neighbors sometimes. Breakfast was good as well, would have preferred hot foods but it filled us up every morning. The main hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Termini which will get you everywhere in Rome. The suite is only a 3 minute walk to a metro(not the Termini) north of it. If you stay in the suites, there's a restuarant called marchi or marci that's next to it that we recommend. For some reason, there's no sign for the restaurant, if we didn't walk past it every day on the way back to the suites we would have never known it was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - comfortable, clean and reasonably well located”
Reviews.Author: sciencegeek101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Crosti during our trip to Europe in January. We stayed in one of the apartments which are about a 5 minute walk from the main hotel building. The apartment had a kitchen/living area (included a fold out bed, 10 euro/night extra per guest), double bedroom and bathroom. It was quite spacious and very clean. The Roma Termini train station is about a 5-10 minute walk but I would highly recommend avoiding this area as much as possible due to the number of pick-pocketers, scammers, begging people, people spitting, urinating etc. Definitely not impressed with the train station! Once you are out of the immediate area around the station it is fine, and Hotel Crosti is located on a pretty quiet street away from this area. The apartments were very close to a Metro station which was very useful. Breakfast was a bit different to the usual, with more sweet things like cake and no hot food but it was nice! Our only reservation about Hotel Crosti was with one of the staff members who showed complete indifference when we arrived at the hotel and told him that a group of men had just attempted to rob us. Perhaps it happens so often around Termini that it comes as no suprise! Tourists going to Rome: beware of theives! We had vomit-like liquid thrown on us and then the people offering tissues etc were actually trying to steal our bags. One man picked up a bag and began to walk off but when we started yelling, put it down. It was very scary. When around the station make sure you know where you're going, don't carry too much and don't stop for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greatest1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Crosti Hotel in Rome could not have been better. It is a delightful small hotel conveniently located (10 minute walk) to mass transit, is very clean, updated with large fully stocked bathrooms, and has a staff that was always pleasant and helpful. Pietra and Giovanni (front desk) went out of their way to give directions, suggestions, warnings, etc. They both spoke very good English which was a great benefit to us since our Italian was very, very limited. The breakfast was included and, although it was self serve, wait staff was always close at hand to take care of us. Our room included everything that we needed - safe, hair dryer, an extra blanket and pillow - with the exception of washclothes which was the trend throughout Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Get more than I pay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Baggio925
Reviews.Content: Excellent!! 5 minutes walk from the train station "Termini". The room is clean and big in size. All necessarities had been provided!! The towels, matress, wall ...all the things are clean!! The breadfast is wonderful!!!! Especially their American coffee, better than lots of the famous cafe in Italy!!! The price is reasonable!! I stayed at there for 6 nights. After that, all I felt was I would like to stay longer in Roma. Next time I visit Roma, I must book Crosti and I have no reservation in recommanding it to all the visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdub50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day trip to Rome and came away very satisfied with our stay at the Crosti Hotel. The only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars, is that it's location is very convenient to the Bus and Train stations, but if you prefer to walk to the sites then it is a little bit out of the way from most of the main historic sites. The rooms were clean, and very good sized. The breakfast every morning was fantastic, and the staff seemed to be very helpful whenever we asked questions. Overall it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel frienty stuff”
Reviews.Author: Lazaroz
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with friendly stuff. The stuff ask me to any question. The breakfast was excelent quality and high quality. Very satisfied from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff; A Little Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: Avecverve
Reviews.Content: Sticking with my plan to pick hotels near train stations so I wouldn't have to walk too far, I did great in Florence, Naples, Siena, and even Venice. But I didn't do too well here. Rome's ferrovia stazione is located in the northeastern corner of the city. This hotel is located even further north than the station. The saving grace was that there are two subway stations nearby. The bad news is that Rome has a exceptionally lousy subway system in terms of convenience. (The reason is that they didn't want to tunnel too much through what could be archaeological remnants. However, an additional line across the south side of the city is in the planning stage.) The staff were exceptionally helpful. This was the case in all of the hotels I stayed in while in Rome this past month. The room was very clean, comfortably large. The only problem I had was the floor was not carpeted, and therefore was very cold to step on at night. Not a big issue, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: MissKareBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both pre and post cruise and would highly recommend this hotel. Both times we checked in, they accommodated our early check in requests, which we really appreciate. The hotel is located about 8 - 10 minutes from the Termini and we had no problems walking to the hotel w/ our luggage in tow. There is also a supermarket a block away where we stocked up on snacks and water. Wifi works well - the front desk will provide you a cable once you identify what internet plan you wish to purchase. 1 hour = $1 Euro, 6 hours = $2 Euro. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and spacious. We had a room facing the streets and did not have any problems w/ noise once the windows are closed. We went out all hours of the day and always felt safe. We really liked the location since it was close to Termini and bus stations - this made it easy to roam around using public transportation. When we go back to Rome, I know Hotel Crosti will be my choice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Sillystupid
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel - had 2 rooms. Arrived very early and staff did all they could to provide us with a room early so that we could freshen up before sightseeing. Nothing too much trouble for staff, rooms clean and well maintained. In room internet worked well and cold buffet breakfast very good. The hotel has an association with a restaurant just up the road and the food there is very good also. Would recommend this hotel to anyone andf definitely stay there when in Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in amazing rome”
Reviews.Author: foreveritalian
Reviews.Content: my partner, my son and I stayed in the hotels apartment for 7 nights ,which is located a short walk from the hotel, on arrival we thought the lift was very tiny you could only fit 1 person with 1 piece of luggage or 3 people without any luggage. but i must say that was all good no problem with lift and we had a few laughs along the way. The apartment was amazing very spacious, very clean, and great coffee machine, there was also a washing machine and clothes line on terrace balcony. the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful especially the breakfast staff and the cleaning lady left our apartment spotless evey day. the apartments was 1 minute walk to station and 5 minute walk to termini station, which was fantastic and so easy to see all the sights. around the area you also have supermarket, cafes, pharmacy,and an internet cafe. the hotel and apartments are in a great location and when we do come back to beautiful rome we will definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome mid-priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJCGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: In Oct. 2009 we spent several days at the Crosti. The best mid-priced hotel we have found in Rome in 40 years of visiting the city. Although we did not stay at the affiliated apartments, we did walk through them and will definitely consider them in the future for longer stays in Rome--roomy, with nice terraces, baths and very clean. Both the apartments and the hotel are family-run and are owned by the family which owns a near-by ristorante, Da Vicenzo--an excellent spot to eat. The staff at both the ristorante and the hotel are very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short break stay, clean,friendly staff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansWendy
Reviews.Content: Good hotel reasonable price good checkin and very helpfull staff, rooms clean and quiet. Good breakfast and good range of times.About 5min walk to main termini station where you can get the metro to all the main attractions very easily. Hotel also have a restaurant in same street which is also good and reasonablily priced but is closed on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BindyJD
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Crosti- the front desk staff were always helpful, lots of restaurants in the street, and famous sites within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMaryland
Reviews.Content: Notes: Internet hookups in room for small fee (they supply the cable if you need it). The challenge when staying by the station is that you're by the station: it's hard to find good food, and when you've been out all day sightseeing and you return home tired but need some dinner, you might not want to trek back into town to find a cute little trattoria. But, you also don't want the equivalent of diner/tourist food when you're in one of the food meccas of the world. So, don't eat at the restaurant across the street -- "Salvatore's" -- it's nasty and the service was dismal. Instead, go diagonally across the street on the next block to Monte Arci -- their pasta was good, the service was cheerful, and there were little touches that make a difference -- they served the bill on top of a few rose petals, with some biscotti, for instance. Or, try La Familgia -- about 3-4 blocks away, perpendicular to Castelfidardo and towards town. As for the hotel, I agree with the other reviews: very clean, well-positioned in terms of convenience to touring around, and the staff is pleasant -- especially the breakfast staff. I would probably stay in a different neighborhood with more personality next time when I don't need to be running from the Coliseum to the Forum to Piazza di Spagna, but this hotel gives you access to all the major action. By the way, the H bus from Termini goes up Via Nazionale to Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: DarlaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews and took a chance. And we were pleasantly surprised. It's small, but for the price, it was great! Breakfast is included and it was the best we had of the 4 others we were in on our trip. Pietro and Stephanya were great. Very close to the termini. I'd say approximately a mile walk. Neighborhood good because it wasn't too close to the termini. Not too far from many of the main places we wanted to see. If you're a walker, you could even walk to many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel offering 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: llongrider1
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed opinions on the Termini area, we stayed with trepidation at the Hotel Crosti. The hotel is wonderful, spotless rooms, sound security and staff that are helpful. The older gentleman at the front desk on Spetember 19 and 20th , welcomed us like long lost family. Being our first trip to Europe we were instantly at ease. The young woman who ran the breakfast was friendly and made the best coffee I have ever tasted. The breakfast was well prepared and more than adequate, and to the coffee was just fantastic ! The Termini area is safe, I did not see any unsavory people nor did I ever feel uncomfortable. You can walk anywhere in Rome from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value........ideal location”
Reviews.Author: DandJCheltenham
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to its reviews on this website. The bus from the airport drops you outside the Termini Station and from there you can walk to the hotel with pullalong suitcases without a problem. The staff are friendly and make every effort to speak English. The rooms are small yet homely and the en-suite facilities first-class. The breakfast is good by continental standards and sets you up well for the day ahead. There are also restaurants in the vicinity where you can get a decent evening meal for a reasonable price. All the main attractions of the city are walkable if you are reasonably fit, though the Vatican may be a tad too far for those not used to footpower. Buses are available form outside the station if you prefer that form of transport and there's also the choice of the open-top buses. For these you can get 24 or 48 hour passes and hop on and off when you please. We managed to 'do' Rome in three days, plenty long enough if you plan your itinerary. The inside of Saint Peter's Basilcia is a must as is the Colosseum. Also have a Macdonalds at the Piazza della Repubblica - the best sited one I've ever come across. The best ice creams were across the road on the way from St Peter's to the Vatican Museum. Unlike Paris, London and many other capitals, the river is a real disappointment, not worth viewing at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious rooms and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: jaindough
Reviews.Content: Crosti hotel was the choice we made for Rome given the location (closeness to Termini station), the price and the other positive reviews we had read on TripAdvisor. We stayed for three nights during our honeymoon this last month. We walked from Termini to the hotel (printed a map out beforehand) and didn't have a hard time finding it. The walk was about 15 minutes. Our check in was a bit early and so the nice deskman allowed us to leave our cases and take a walk while our room was being cleaned for us. We found the room to be rather spacious given european standards, and the bathroom was very modern and attractive. Our room was on the first floor, behind a second set of security doors (which slammed and were loud.) We did not hear any street traffic at night and since we were early risers, we were not disturbed by the slamming of doors (and tried our hardest to be quiet!) We never felt unsafe in the area, even when returning after a late night dinner. There is a delightful deli just one block west of the hotel that we frequented several times. It's a great place for a panini, a cheap bottle of wine and some delicious authentic italian antipasta (delicious artichokes!) There is also a cute street market near this deli during the weekdays. We are in our early thirties and walked EVERYwhere from this hotel. All the way to the colosseum, the vatican, you name it. We never once took a taxi, metro or bus. We felt we saw a lot of the city in this way. The breakfasts were filling and got us through our very active mornings. The selection was not over the top, but for our standards it was ample enough. The capuccinos were very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: kabadi
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel from the termini station was a problem. Even the locals could not know where it is(but it is only 2 streets from the termini station. Looked very small from outside but once you get in it looked so posch. Very friendly staff. The best hotel to stay if you are not hiring a car. Everything is walking distance. The breakfast in the morning is heaven. The dinning room is like a tiny space but they had the varieties of breakfast and the freshly brewed coffee the best one we had in italy.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel so much we came back for one more night”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, well located and the service was excellent. Not only did we get our questions answered but also had an enjoyable time. Breakfast buffet was perfect, concierge went out of their way to be helpful and make our trip the "best ever" I cannot wait to get back to Rome and the Crosti and I will recommend it to anyone who is going to Rome and wants to see it by walking, taxi or public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: omega
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed with the Crosti - for a budget rate hotel it has everything for a comfortable stay. The rooms are well equipped and spotlessly clean if a little on the small side. The staff were friendly and very helpful, offering advice on sights, transport, restaurants, etc. Their advice was always spot on. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BobKDetroit
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Crosti Hotel. Small comfortable room. Very nice breakfast with the best coffee. Would definitely stay there again. Good restaruant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: brachync
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, great breakfast, clean rooms. Without hesitation I would would stay here again and recommend it to all friends and family traveling to Rome. My daughter and I felt very safe in the hotel and the location. It was an easy walk to the train station. We began and ended our trip in Italy at the Crosti.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel...hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jerry7mac
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel to finish our 2 week honeymoon in Europe. It was nicely decorated and had a comfortable bed. The A/C was nice and cold, thank God, because it was really hot outside. The hotel is close to the train station and about 3 blocks from the nearest metro. The complimentary water in the room was unbelievable considering you don't get water free at most places in Europe. Staff was friendly and nice. The hotel is not close to any landmarks, but the metro is 3 blocks away. Tickets for the metro are very inexpensive and this is definitely the way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great location, family environment...went above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: Dotty888
Reviews.Content: The Crosti Hotel is the loveliest, friendliest hotel in a great location in Rome. Steps from the train station, the metro, and within walking distance of major sites, the location is ideal. It's on a quiet street with lots of amenities close by. The rooms are lovely and clean and the bathrooms are large and modern. Our room was cool and quiet, a welcome retreat in the heat of the summer. The buffet breakfast was fantastic, with everything from fresh fruit to cereal to baked goods to frittatas to cakes, complete with juice and an excellent cappucino. And the staff...amazing...they went the extra mile with a smile. They provided us with great advice on day trips (far better than the guy at the tourist info booth), they told us about fantastic places to eat, and they treated us like we were family. In addition to a great hotel, the family runs a restaurant just up the street and it was some of the best food and service we had anywhere in Italy. They treated us like family there, too. Overall, an exceptional stay. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and everybody. I certainly hope to return to Rome and the Crosti as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down amazing service, location, and value.”
Reviews.Author: newby5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to the train station, and within walking distance of most major downtown attractions. The staff are superb. The restaurant that they run as well has amazing food, and friendly service. They totally exceeded our expectations, and we would recommend them highly to anyone looking for affordable accomodations in rome. We cant wait to go back. They made our visit. The breakfast thats included is amazing too, well beyond your normal continental. Absolutely fantastic!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Varrie
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent but the staff make it outstanding. My room wasn't very large but had everything I needed and was immaculate. Breakfast was lovely and all the food was very fresh. Without exception the staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Take recommendations from reception staff very seriously because the restaurants they told us about were great and very good value for money. The district it's in isn't too touristy and so the surroundings aren't too busy but it's only a short to Termini. I loved Rome and I'm returning soon and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Maz52
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights in the Crosti Hotel. It was very easy to find and took us about 12 minutes to walk from the Termini station metro (and that was with 1 of our case wheels breaking off- darn cobbles!!) We were very impressed by this hotel. Security was good, with a double swipe system to access the bedrooms. The bathroom was tiled to a high standard with a brilliant power shower and the bedroom was air conditioned, clean and airy. The room had a fridge, safe and really powerful hairdryer, which was very useful. Breakfast was fine, with the usual range of cereals, meats, cheeses, and pasteries. One very minor disappointment was the luke-warm water served for tea and coffee...but hey, we were in Rome, it wasn't a big deal!!! The hotel receptionists were so very helpful and recommended great restaurants for our evening meals...nothing was too much trouble. Although we walked everywhere, we were sometimes glad to get a taxi back to the hotel - the cost was reasonable, between 7 and 9 euro from the Collesseum and from the Vatican. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Crosti Hotel and would happily return any time we were visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LaurenPete
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it’s close proximity to the train station and it’s very reasonable price (we booked through a well known travel website). We paid approximately £55 a night for a double room but on arrival we noticed the rooms ranged from about 135 euros a night to 185 euros a night (our room). So definitely worth booking in advance through a reputable travel website! As long as you print out a Google map with the hotel’s location it is easy to find and about a 5 minute walk from Rome Termini (the main train station in Rome). On arrival we were expecting the worst because of the cheap price and location but we were very pleasantly surprised! It was our honeymoon so they gave us one of the nicest rooms in the hotel which was on the first floor. The room was spacious with a high ceiling and a beautifully tiled floor. The hotel was very modern (obviously recently renovated) and the room had air conditioning which kept us nice and cool. Our bathroom was amazing. It was beautifully done out and we even had a Jacuzzi bath which was an unexpected (especially because of what we had paid for the room!) surprise! The breakfast was also very nice (buffet where there was plenty of choice) and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There was also a good choice of restaurants near the hotel so if you were tired from a days sightseeing you wouldn’t have to go back into the centre of Rome. We tried one pizzeria straight up the road from the hotel and it was lovely and great value. The hotel actually owned a restaurant down the road but we didn’t have a chance to try this. The only slight criticism I can think of (and I have had to think hard) was that the fridge didn’t seem to work in our room. But this was such a small and probably one of thing that I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was staying in Rome. Tip - I would recommend getting a tourist bus from the station - you can get a two day (48 hour) ticket for about 23 euros each and can hop on and hop off all you want. It's a great way to see all of Rome's attractions and get your bearings. However if you didn't want to do this there are metros and buses from the station.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kinetickyle
Reviews.Content: It's affordable and basic, but very clean and nice. The two things that make the Crosti Hotel so great are its location and staff. It's only about a mile from Termini Station, so the whole city is accessible from it and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. I simply can't say enough nice things about the Crosti Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: booksandme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights of a three day visit to Rome and loved it. I found it easy to walk to the Quirinale, the Pantheon, The Spanish Steps, The Vittorio Emanuele II Monument, The Palatine, The Coloseum, etc. The hotel was lovely - a nice spacious room and bathroom and although I was in a corner room with roads on two sides there was very little noise. The breakfast was sumptuous with a huge variety of foods on offer. The staff were very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in Rome - very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paula083
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the great reviews on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. This was our second trip to Rome and this hotel made it just as special the second time round. This is a small hotel about 5 minutes walk from the train station. All the main tourist attractions are walkable but there is also good metro links as well as the tour buses (recommended). The room we had was very clean, with a very big comfy bed, great air conditining and a lovely bathroom. They provide a buffet style breakfast which was lovely. All the staff were very helpful and very polite. The surrounding area was nice and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, high security, nice room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ringmac
Reviews.Content: East 10 min walk from train station with main bus stops and metro 5 mins away. Very modern and "new feeling" hotel with ultra clean american style rooms - strong air con, flat screen TV, safe, fridge and good bathroom. Popular with business travellers. Huge breakfast and a few trattorias close by - Trattoria Andrea was good. We liked walking and walked to the Pantheon, Colloseum, Trevvi fountain, Vatican etc bus you are close to the public transport if you prefer as Rome is spread out. Campo de'Fiori is lively in the evening with diners and drinkers and bus 62 goes there from the top of the road. A must is the Roma pass (can be bought from the hotel) - 23 euros and includes free transport for 3 days includes buses and metros and free entry into 2 major attractions, you get the most value if you use it for the Colloseum/Palatine and the Capitol Museums (excellent museum). This hotel is great value in Rome - we got it for £115 a night on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamPepys
Reviews.Content: I primarily booked room here as a hotel close to Termini for the final two days of a long trip. It is in the middle of an area with a number of hotels and restaurants. Not particular scenic. Having stayed here, however, I would be happy to return (and I wish my first hotel in Rome had been this one). The room was very good, the staff responsive, the breakfast quite nice. It did have an elevator that required a key and a couple steps up before you get to it, but that was no issue for us. If you know your way around Rome, there is no problem getting anywhere you want to go. I would recommend it without hesitation to those who do not need to live in the middle of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closely located to Termini station, it takes about 4-5 minutes on foot. I was a bit concerned about the noise from the street (clubs, restaurants), but I closed the shutters and it was all very quiet). There is a small restaurant next to the hotel where the pizza is very good. (most waiters are Asian, I don`t know the name of the place). I was able to do the whole center of Rome on foot and still get back to the hotel safely. (the staff gave me a map and explained everything). One last word of advice,: don`t pick a cab at random, Book one in advance!!! It can get a bit rough in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Crosti!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelNC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy and had a great 2 night stay at the Hotel Crosti! The room was perfect for our needs, clean and spacious. The shower is a little on the small side but the bathroom in general was a good size. The staff is very accommodating and courteous, and definitely the best included breakfast we had during our trip! We found the location to be good, we took the 75 bus right across from the small supermarket up the street (where you'll find the best deal on water!) to the Colosseum and then spent the day walking around the city to all the other sites and walked back to our hotel from there. You can use the in-room Internet for 3 Euros, for 24hrs, which was a good deal and we found helpful due to a flight problem. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Crosti, and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and a good location”
Reviews.Author: klairen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of the central station, there are plenty of cafes and a supermarket nearby. The staff I met were all very helpful, friendly and professional. The receptionist was expecting me when I arrived and was happy to point out places of interest on a map before showing me to my double room. This was spotlessly clean, tastefully decorated with a large tv, wardrobe with safe and hairdryer, mini bar and an en suite with a small corner shower, towels and toiletries. (No bath tub) The breakfast is served downstairs and there is a nice atmosphere in the small breakfast room as well as a great selection of fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, cakes, croissants, bread, cheese, meat and omelettes. All in all this is a good base for sightseeing, close to the station, clean, modern and a breakfast to set you up for the day. I feel I got great value for money at the Crosti hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable base from which to explore Rome.”
Reviews.Author: oldchelt
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this 3 star hotel and were not disappointed. Our room, though not large, was very clean. The bathroom with toilet, bidet and shower was also very clean with towels changed daily. The only minor criticism was that there was no mirror in the bedroom area. The windows were double glazed with the addition of very effective shutters and curtains which kept out any noise and light. The staff were generally helpful and friendly. This is a well located hotel, only five minutes walk from the Termini Metro/bus station – manageable even with a bag and suitcase. We used the Terravision Ciampino airport to Rome transfer bus which stops at Termini – a good bet and only 8 Euro return. Although we used the Metro for getting to some of the sights it doesn’t generally cater for the main sights. From the hotel my suggestion would be to walk 5 minutes to Via 20 Settembre and catch the number 492 bus ( it goes from the central reservation in the road). This bus takes you very near the Pantheon and Ponte Umberto areas – a far better option than using the depressing, crowded, graffiti ridden sights of the Metro. There are several Trattoria/Pizzeria along from the Crosti including one recommended by the hotel. However, we ate on three occasions at Trattoria Pizzeria Andrea, a traditional trattoria – great food and atmosphere. It was full each night whilst others were not. All in all a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mollyluv
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in the Crosti hotel for 3 nights and were delighted we didi!I chose the Crosti hotel based on the reviews here on trip advisor and what a great choice it was. The room was immaculate, the breakfast was spot on, the service was exellent, the location was perfect and the price was great!I don't have a bad thing to say about this hotel.The room was a very spacoius double room with a large beautiful shower room. On the last day we were not flying out until 8pm and they let us leave our bags in the reception while we went out!We both had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingLady
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crosti Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything stated in the reviews is correct - the hotel room is immaculate, the breakfast is great, the price was right and the staff is most helpful. We were in a two room suite, which was a pleasant surpise since we were expecting a cramped room for 3. The only caveat I would have about recommending this hotel, is to say that you need to be the kind of traveler who doesn't mind using public transportation. While there are good restuarants in the area, evening activity is around Piazza Navona or Popolo. Both are short cab rides or Metro rides away, and the location was not a problem for us. We felt the cost savings was worth the slight inconvenience. BTW with respect to the review about graffiti in the neighborhoods. Rome in general has a lot of graffiti even in the most upscale neighborhoods. That was a surprise. Anyway, this neighborhood was clean and I never felt unsafe. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: jenniiiii
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic two-night stay in the Crosti Hotel. On arrival we were given a huge two bedroomed room, despite there only being two of us. The two bedroomed room had a bathroom and an additional separate toilet, which I think would have been quite handy had there have been four of us in the one room. The room itself was squeaky clean, and although I had looked at other travellers pictures on trip advisor before I left, I thought it looked much more modern and much larger in the flesh. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is located near the termini station (10 minutes walk) which is very handy if you are flying to Rome, as coach transfers from both Rome Fiumicino and Rome Ciampino go to the termini station. The hotel is also close to two metro stations, which we used for getting around the city as we wanted to see as much as possible during our short stay. Tickets for the metro can be bought from the station, you can pay 1 euro for a metro ticket which lets you do as many journeys as you like in 75minutes or 4 euros for an all day ticket (these tickets can be used both on the metro and the bus). The street which Crosti is situated on has other hotels all along it, and a fair few family run restaurants. When we arrived at the hotel the man who welcomed us gave us a map and pointed out the best way to get to the main attractions, as well as a run down on the local restaurants. We also went to Da Vincenzo's - the hotels own restaurant which was down the street and thought it was very nice. The reason that I have given the hotel 4 out of 5 for location is that whilst the location is excellent in a practical sense, for me it lacked the wow factor as in it did not have fantastic views, fantastic boutiques or bars nearby. Breakfast was fantastic at Crosti Hotel, as mentioned in other reviews there is a continental buffet breakfast featuring, toast, meats, cheeses, eggs, cereals, fruit, cakes and fresh pastries. There is also fresh fruit juice and the choice of tea and coffee on offer. I booked this hotel using the online hotel site expedia and paid a fantastic price for our stay. I know that larger hotels may have facilities that Crosti Hotel did not have, such as swimming pools and a gym, but I came to Rome looking to do some site-seeing and to soak up a bit of Italian culture, so for me to stay in this little immacutely clean family run hotel was a real treat! I would go back to the Crosti hotel in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lizbuffSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel and we were both very pleasantly surprised. We had read the reviews, which is why we chose it, but you can never really be sure about a place until you have visited it for yourself. The hotel is within walking distance of the Termini, approx 10 minutes (and we were carrying handluggage). We were welcomed at the hotel by a very nice gentleman who offered to arrange any visits or tours we might like to undertake. He highlighted the various attractions that we might like to visit in Rome on a handy map, which he gave us. He then showed us to a lovely room on the second floor with en-suite facilities. The room was clean and very well equiped with a t.v., safe and fridge. Our room overlooked quite a busy road, but with the windows closed you couldn't hear the traffic. The room did come with air-conditioning, but we didn't use it. The breakfast! You will be completely spoilt for choice! There is cereal, juice, rolls, bread, cake, cheese, ham, eggs, omlette, fresh fruit, yoghurt, croissants and the most delicious coffee (you can have tea if you prefer!). We found that after a breakfast like that, you couldn't eat another thing until 4pm! The hotel owners have a restaurant down the road and they offer a 10% discount on your meal. The only warning I would give is that we couldn't find a menu outside, so didn't know the prices until we sat down. They are reasonable for the area, for example I had a large bowl of spaghetti, which cost 8 euros, which I didn't think was too bad. Overall, a very nice hotel and we felt very welcome, so we would book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: basil56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Crosti is a small family owned hotel. They provide excellent all round service. The breakfasts in the morning were superb, and their recommendations for surrounding restaurants were most helpful. Our rooms were made up immaculately by the chamber maids each day. We had an incident where by my son left his small business card wallet in our room, and we contacted the hotel when we were in Belgrade to advise them of this, and without hesitation they posted it back to our home address in New Zealand. Nothing was a problem. The night staff (especially Boris) was always very welcoming in wanting to know how our day went and what our plans were for tomorrow. There is a real caring attitude from all the staff. Very good location also - near to all of Rome's famous attractions. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, good breakfast buffet, friendly staff - bargain.”
Reviews.Author: JoanCDallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bargain! The rooms are clean and quiet. The only drawback is the size of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Well located basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: danw71
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Crosti was an excellent base to see Rome from. We had a good corner room with a lovely vaulted ceiling. All the furnishings were of a decent standard and it was scrupulously clean. The staff were all obliging and professional and the breakfast was fine. All it lacked was a bar which would have been useful given that the majority of local places were closed by eight. The best thing about it was the location, five minutes from Termini station, handy for a couple of Metro stops and good for buses. If you want to walk it's a twenty minute stroll to The Trevi Fountain and the local area has useful shops, some good restaurants and decent bars (when open). The room rate advertised at the hotel looked a bit steep to me but we booked through a website and got a very good price. It was an excellent, unfussy base for a few days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to stay in Rome.............”
Reviews.Author: soaringspirit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crosti from the 15-21st. The location was great....Very safe. Good security. I didt think the nieghborhood was seedy. Good food options around,,,,I loved Da Vincenzos.Quality seafood. Noise is solved with earplugs....this is typical for Rome, Paris, London.Staff were very helpful. You can walk to the Borgese.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1979
Reviews.Content: The Crosti hotel is a small family run boutique hotel within walking distance of all the main sites in Rome. The rooms were large and clean and the hotel staff very friendly. The highlight was the amazing breakfast - everything you could possibly want and more - its provided by a sister restaurant which I would also recommend for some genuine roman food off the tourist track. Highly recommended especially given the value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: braceman
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel the first four days of 2009 and thoroughly enjoyed it. We came into Rome on the train from Pisa and took the train to the airport when we left (12 euros each) which is why I wanted a hotel close to the train station. The room was clean and had two twin beds pushed together, a mini-fridge, a TV, and a shower (no bathtub). This is a quiet area of town but appeared to be safe. The only sounds I heard at night were fireworks New Years Eve, but I always use a sound machine when traveling. I never did see the porn theatre/strip club I kept reading about, so I guess you have to look for it. I also didn't see any strange people hanging around. There is a supermarket close by if you want to pick up a few things to munch on. There are several good restaurants in the area. We had two good meals at a restaurant down the street owned by the same people who owned the hotel (Vincenzo's). The hotel had a nice breakfast buffet with ham, cheese, boiled eggs, juice, etc. A great way to start the day! We walked from the hotel to the colisseum, over to the parthenon, and back to the hotel. This is the best way to experience Rome. We also took the metro a few times and felt safe. A one day pass good on the metro and buses was 4 euros. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Great place to stay without spending a fortune!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Crosti Hotel's front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: sergeyvzn
Reviews.Content: it's an OK hotel but many reviews here overrate it. Stayed there from the 1st till 3d of February but don't think I will again First, the location is not good, it's in the middle of the seedy area around Termini, just around a corner there is a porn movie theatre, lots of bizarre people around, strongly reminds me of Tenderloin in San Francisco. If you can afford a little extra - do not stay anywhere near Termini! Second, the room walls are paper thin - I could hear people next door using the toilet and could tell what they were doing, the sound is amazingly clear, as if it's just near my bed - not terribly pleasant. Third - their staff is weird, I had a friend who lives in Rome visit me, he rang from the street as the door was locked (at 4 pm!!) and I had to go downstairs to meet him and take him to my room, we were going to have a beer and chat but a second later there was a knock on the door and their front desk person was there telling me that I was not allowed to bring anyone to my room!!! I was slightly shocked and asked him why and he said these were the hotel regulations! My friend spoke Italian to him and somehow pursuaded him he was OK and was not going to murder or rob me in my room so he stayed but we both did not enjoy the beer as we were both angry and finally decided to go out. It's an OK hotel, clean, the breakfast was fantastic but rooms are quite small, you can hardly walk around the bed. Overall - OK but be aware of their front desk people!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rosemary_williamson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have recently returned from the Crosti Hotel and it was fantastic value for money. The service was impeccable, the rooms were squeaky clean and the bed was enormous. Also, breakfast was delicious with a large spread, buffet style. The bathrooms are very stylish and very tasteful and the security of the rooms is second to none! Very friendly and extrenely helpful staff.
