The hotel is located on a quiet street just outside the city centre, but is within 10-15 minutes walking distance of San Pietro and the Ancient ruins on the way to the Colosseum. Very close to Via Nazionale, which is one of the best shopping streets in Rome, and just 5 minutes from the Termini train station (Termini Metro Station) The restaurants in close proximity to the hotel are also gorgeous. Amazing home-cooked food and very reasonable. None of the touristy rubbish you can get roped into in the centre of Rome. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone needing a comfortable, very reasonably priced, well located hotel in the centre of (in my opinion) the best city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlantean22000
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel--arrived early but were allowed to check into our room.Staff very friendly.Rooms spotless nice flat screen tv and fridge with toiletries in bathroom. Excellent buffet breakfast highly recommended would definately stay there again.Only 5 minute walk from bus and train stations

Reviews.Title: “Didn't dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: Ozhoneymooner
Reviews.Content: Given I was looking for a moderately priced hotel in Rome over NYE I was concerned what I would end up with. After thorough internet research I decided on the Crosti. The reviews on this and other sites are accurate. This is a very good basic hotel. Location wise: 5min walk to Termini station and bout 10min to all other historical sites..note no major sites are in immediate vicinity. You can easliy walk to all sites though except Vatican. Room was small as expected but clean and a king bed. Very cheap in room internet was supplied (4 Euro for 24 hours of useage). Bathroom very modern and clean. Nice breakfast supplied didn't dissapoint. Front desk staff were very helpful in pointing out local eateries of whch there are many. All in all an excellent 3+ star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kayaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother in law, we stayed at the Crosti hotel last september (2008). That's a great hotel, very clean, delicious breakfest, walking distance from Termini and a supermarket. Very helpfull staff. The reviews were quit right. I'd not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: miss-sharni
Reviews.Content: This place is really good value for Rome (though we did book through lastminute.com). The cleanliness of the rooms was exemplary, with everything tidied and restocked daily. The reception staff were really helpful and the restaurant staff made breakfast a joy. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I Really wanted to Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, I booked the Hotel Crosti for a 4 night stay in November 2008. Adriano at reception is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were very stark, having no pictures or mirrors or anything on the walls. We called it our little convent room since it really looks like where we'd live if we were nuns! The real issue with the hotel is the noise. We were on the first floor and the street noise is incredible at night but worse is the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything in every room near you. Toilets flushing sound like a flood will occur in the ceilings, you can hear your neighbors touching hangers in their closets. The noise made it a challenge to sleep. The location is good with close access to both the blue and red metro lines (each within a 10 minute walk). The restaurant owned by the family, DiVincenzo's, was outstanding and we ate there twice. I really wanted to love this more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Little Find!”
Reviews.Author: Clayre8077
Reviews.Content: Just back today from a 3 night stay at The Crosti (£176 for 2 people for the duration via lastminute.com). As the previous reviewer noted, the hotel is aproximately 10 minutes walk away from the termini (main train/metro/bus station) & is easily found once you have your bearings. The Trevi fountain is aproximately 30 minute walk away for those who enjoy a stroll. The hotel staff were always very friendly, courteous & helpful when asked to recommend resturaunts etc etc. The hotel has recently been refurbished & although the rooms are small, they are more than adequate for a short break & are nicely decorated & modern (flat screen TV on wall). The bathroom is spacious & has an excellent power shower & large mirror. The street outside can be noisy, however there are shutters on the windows which can be adjusted to your liking & we had no problems with noise. The heating unit can be used as central heating in winter & air conditioning in summer. Breakfast is served between 7-10am & is a cold buffet style with all the usual breads, pastries, cheese, meat etc. All in all, an excellent hotel in a good location & a great find! Very well priced for such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CASTLEFOX
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a two night stay at the Crosti. It's in a great location just 10 minutes stroll from the main railway/metro station. The hotel is quite new and the room was modern if a little small. The bathroom was spacious and the whole place was spotlessly clean. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. We had an early start on the last day and they arranged an early breakfast for us. Unfortunately we were delayed when the airport closed for two days and had to stay an extra 2 nights. The Crosti was full and we ended up in a 4 star hotel at over double the price. it wasn't a patch on the Crosti. Good value hotel at £70 per night for a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Not Overly Friendly”
Reviews.Author: reese_36
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Crosti for two nights in November. The hotel is clean and we felt safe. The location is excellent and the area around the Termini wasn't as sketchy as some reviews have made it sound. The front desk staff are helpful but are by no means friendly. We felt bad asking them for anything. All in all, a good value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This was a lovely place to stay - the apartment”
Reviews.Author: amjcuk
Reviews.Content: On arrival met by Paulo, the owner, who explained there had been a problem with the water supply and we were going to stay at the apartments he also owns. Read about this happening before so was not worried and the apartment was lovely so we stayed there for the 4 nights. Perfect place for easy access to the whole city and lovely restaurants around - had a lovely meal at Babbos last night and hope to go back to Rome again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suegeordie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Crosti Hotel and have nothing but positive things to say. Giovanni, Boris, Adrian and Said plus the ladies in the breakfast room could not have been more helpful or friendlier. The hotel location was perfect--just a 10 minute walk to the Termini Station and within walking distance of most of the major tourist attractions. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed. Only criticism is the t.v. only has one English channel--CNN. Breakfast was plentiful, with lots of choice and good coffee. All in all, we would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base Camp - Nothing more”
Reviews.Author: westiefergus76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for one night only, and to be fair it was perfectly adequate. The room was a bit on the small side, as was the bathroom. Its only 200 metres from Termini train station. We arrived at 22:30, navigating through the back streets of Rome was nerve racking. I wouldn't advise staying any longer than one night, plenty of nicer hotels with bigger rooms. Staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast was very nice. On the whole a pleasant experience. If your only planning one night in Rome then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the Crosti”
Reviews.Author: leeds_person
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at Crosti hotel. Rooms nice and modern. Staff helpful. Recommend buying the Roma pass from the hotel 20 euros. Gets 3 day travel on the metro or buses, gets you in to 2 museums free (used it for colosseum/formum and a museum near termini) then rest reduced. Felt good walking past everyone in the colosseum queue and walking straight to the front with the roma pass, likewise in the forum. hotel is 3 mins walk from Termini or republica metro stations. We liked the hotel location. There are lots of good eateries around there 'Trattorias?', serving good food at reasonable prices. Found these restaurants better than in central rome. Guide books don't really rate this area, but we found it a good area to stay away from the hustle and bustle of central rome. Connected well by the metro and bus links, about 30 mins on foot to Trevi fountain etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara064
Reviews.Content: We rather liked this place. Our room was just a hotel room, not one of the apartments that I had read about; the room was small (aren't they all in Europe?) but pleasant enough and with modern soundproof shuttered windows. Good bathroom and nice towels (after our Florence experience of those weird, thin Italian towels, these were welcome). No eggs and bacon but a good breakfast offered for this part of the world (included in price). There was quite a complicated series of security doors to breach to get to our room but I guess that makes for safety. The staff were helpful, especially Boris who helped us to complete our airline internet check-in. Rome is a wonderful city to visit, easy to get around on foot. It was only on our last day that we managed to suss out the metro system. The Metrebus ticket (4 euros for a whole day for use on either bus or metro) is great value and the double decker tourist bus is invaluable for getting your bearings when you first arrive in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alh717
Reviews.Content: My wife, Mother-in-law and myself stayed in a triple room on September 23 to the 26. The room was great the treatment by staff terrific and breakfast was wonderful. The Hotel is located close to Termini and there are restaurants all around. I will certainly stay here again. Have all ready recomended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation, good location”
Reviews.Author: Eternaloptimist58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at apartments owned by the hotel because the hotel was fully booked. The apartments were about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The accomodation was of a very high standard, as was the customer service provided by the hotel staff. We were on the 7th floor and our friends were on the 6th - fortunately there was a small lift so it didn't cause us any problems. We couldn't fault our vist to Rome and would recommend the Crosti Hotel and the apartments to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Crosti Appartments part of the Crosti Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: esperiaAtwell
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful stay at the Crosti hotel Appartments in rome new service operated by hotel. We had an appartment on the 6th floor of the Villa Franca building Approximately 5min walk to the hotel and 5min walk to main train and bus terminal. Had breakfast every morning at hotel included in the cost of staying at the appartment , appartment was a 2 room 1 bathroom with washing machine and kitchen we request one with a terrace had a beautiful terrace not much view but great restaraunts within a 1min walk took our disabled daughter with us and she loved it too. Met a few people staying at the hotel they all said lovely rooms good price. Staff were helpful De Agliesh the main front desk person was extremely helpful it he couldnt help he would look up on the internet for us had no trouble with language barrier i am english speaking only, staff speak several languages. Appartment was cleaned daily supermarket around the corner. Had a great stay check it out if in Rome ring them personally and request what you would like they gave us a great rate we stayed 10days

Reviews.Title: “Crosti + Boris = GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Arrived early on a Sunday morning and told our room was ready. Great as we took a red eye from Montreal and needed a shower. It was very hot in Rome (36 degrees Celsius) so it was great that the rooms are small as it cooled down in 5 minutes. Buffet breakfast is great and it set us up for hours of sightseeing. Also we had a problem with taking money out at a bank (accepted card but no money came out of machine) and the very helpful Boris let us check post haste on our banks website to see if any money was taken out of our bank account. Since it was late at night and every thing was closed we were relieved to see no money was withdrawn. We stayed 5 nights but wished we spent a couple of more days in Rome as there is so much to see and the Hotel Crosti is great!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: anonymous004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money, the rooms are spotlessly clean- especially the bathrooms, the same goes for the general areas within the hotel. The staff were helpful and pleasant, nothing was too much trouble. Our room was available early, they alllowed us into breakfast early one morning when we had an early start for a trip. The location is convenient, a five minute walk from the Termini Station, where you can also get the hop-on hop-off bus. A late night taxi back from the centre of Rome cost 8 eros, though you could walk if you were feeling energetic! I would thoroughly recommend this hotel & would be happy to stay here again on any visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: thumper1
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on Expedia and stayed for 3 days. The free breakfast buffet offered a lot of choices of hot and cold foods. The room was clean and comfortable. It is about a 5 minute walk from the Termini. Boris spoke excellent English and gave us good suggestions of places to go and things to do. We found it easy for getting around -- Boris suggested we get a Roma Pass which gave us 3 days of transportation and 3 days of attractions admissions (2 free, the rest discounted) which saved us some money. He also told us that we could stretch to six days if we used 3 days of attractions and then 3 days of transportation or vice versa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: effinald
Reviews.Content: I read some good reviews for this hotel on tripadvisor, and for the price thought i would give it a go. Hotel crosti is about 10 mins walk from termini station on via castelfidardo. The apartment we were allocated was not in the main hotel, but a block 5 mins walk away on via villafranca. There was a lounge, kitchen, decent sized bedroom (with safe) and bathroom and kitchen with cooker, fridge, microwave, toaster and kettle and a good sized balcony. Some days(but not all) the hotel leaves complimentary fruit, yoghurt, water, crispbread and jam/butter/nutella in the room.The area is quiet, although the walls are a bit thin between rooms. The airconditioning was good. Staff were helpful, and on arrival we were driven to the apartment with our luggage. The block had 7 floors, and the lift was a little on the small size (but adequate) and if you can operate the lock on the ground floor first time you are a better man than i. Breakfast comprised cakes, croissants, cheese,cold meats, cereals, fruit juice, cold (in general) scrambled egg, fruit, fruit juice, yoghurts and coffee/tea. The apartment was a few minutes walk from the nearest metro on line b which allows access to the main sites. Walking took about 30 minutes to the main attractions;spanish steps etc. There are a few restaurants nearby, and if you ask at reception they will give you a card for a restaurant in the next road which provides good food (and 10% discount). There is a supermarket a few minutes walk away. Overall, the hotel is reasonably priced for rome. I was surprised not to be in the same place as the hotel (maybe i should have read the reviews in more detail), but the apartment more than made up for the short walk to breakfast. The breakfast is more than adequate, and travel is easy. (buy a metro/bus ticket for 1 euro for one day). The rooms were clean and tidy and cleaned daily. If i were to return to rome i would definitely consider returning to hotel crosti.

Reviews.Title: “A great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldfogies
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews before booking the Crosti for ourselves, we thought it important to add to the comments. We have just spent 5 nights there and we could only agree with all the positive comments that have gone before. I was rather intrigued by the layout as we appeared to have apartments above us - the washing gave it away! but the explanation from a previous comment of converted apartments makes sense. It also means you have peace and quiet and no long rambling corridors and noisy door banging. I suspect opinions vary according to how much has been paid and we had a great deal on the internet. The rooms were always spotless, the bathroom was enornous with jacuzzi bath. The bedroom was also large with a huge 6 foot bed, so I guess, because of the hotel layout, it is the luck of the draw, what size you get. The breakfasts were always excellent and it was hard to resist the range of pastries etc. We were not very enthused by the coffee which was pretty flavourless and sometimes rather cool to be honest. Staff could not be more helpful and friendly and always greeted you personally everytime you were within their sight. Location is fine, it is a city after all and compared to the many tourist class (but very expensive) hotels I have had the misfortune to stay in in London and New York I would go back to the Crosti every time. Their advice and guidance was honest and helpful and it was clearly a new and family run enterprise and they are working hard to provide an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: PammyJay
Reviews.Content: If your expectations are not high this is a great place to stay. Overall the rooms are good for the price, and the bathrooms very spacious and clean (which is important). I thought the breakfast was fantastic and staff really friendly. I found the hotel to be a bit unique, in that random apartments have been bought in a residential block and each converted into several hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean convenient cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sadm705
Reviews.Content: Hotel.com provided an excellent deal on this hotel and we were delighted by the value for money, proximity to Rome's main attractions, cleanliness, air conditioning and friendliness of the staff. Although the rooms are not spacious, they are more than adequate for a couple, with recently refurbushed bathrooms which are spotlessly decorated with power-shower and bidet. Reception staff were excellent in offering directions for both walking and metro stops, though all the major sights are within walking distance if you are reasonably fit. Although relatively near to the Terminus, Crosti is far enough away to be well clear of this less savoury district warned about by most of the guide books. Rome can be expensive, but there are a number of reasonably priced eating places very close to the Crosti, and there is a decent bar, frequented by locals but with friendly staff, right across the road from the hotel entrance. Everyone appears to be able to speak enough English to order food and drink without any problems. Had a most enjoyable stay and will definitely return to the same hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but clean”
Reviews.Author: NocilantroNYC
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in this hotel for our family of four (my husband and I were traveling with our teenage sons), and stayed three nights. While the boys' room with two single beds was a decent size, our room with a double bad was unusually cramped, even by the scaled-down expectations we were used to for European hotels. The rooms were clean but with no charm or personality, whatsoever. The men at the front desks were surprisingly uniform in their lack of interest in being helpful. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel at agood price”
Reviews.Author: Evasteva
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a fantastic location near the central train/metro/bus station.The street on which the hotel is located is pleasant and quiet (considering how noisy Rome is) with a Pharmacy, a local cafe (located just across the street) and about five restaurants all populated with local diners. The room we stayed in was very clean with all the features you would expect from a three star hotel. The cleanliness of the bathroom was exceptional. The staff were very helpful and obliging and the breakfast in the morning was better than most four star hotels. The hotel also felt very secure with a key card access system and a safe located in the bedroom. The heat while we stayed was incredible in the high twentys during the night and the air conditioning functioned okay considering the heat that probably would have been my only complaint. Overall a fantastic find and one I would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveandDavid
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel a short walk from the main train station. Not close to the tourist sites, but a nice neighborhood, quiet with resturants close by. We walked, took subways and were able to get where we needed post haste. Breakfast was more than adequate and the staff was matter of fact and helpful. Rooms clean with very nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in a great location. Walking distance to the main tran station and local transportation. Due to noise and prices we never stay in "city centers." Hotel Crosti is a great value and in a nice location if you do not mind walking 5-10 minutes to the underground subway. The hotel staff was extremely nice. The free breakfast was excellent. The breakfast was way above the standard free hotel breakfast. We were on the first floor and found the hotel quiet. The room was really clean and updated. The hotel even booked tours for us prior to leaving the US.

Reviews.Title: “Crosti Hotel is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKelli
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Crosti was very enjoyable. We walked from the Roma Termini train station to the hotel (it took us 15 - 20 min.). We stayed at the Crosti June 4th through June 7th and again on June 15th. On both occasions the room was very pleasant. The desk clerks were very nice and friendly. We especially liked Adrian. Adrian's customer service skills were a welcome change after a hectic day of site seeing among the Romans and other visitors The rooms were clean, large enough, and comfortable with views of the city from the windows. The bathrooms were also very accommodating. Lots of water pressure in the shower (if this is important to you) and the water is always hot. The air conditioning is O.K. Breakfast at the hotel was adequate. Good cappuccino, sweet croissants, meat, cheese, orange juice, and good pastry, etc. There are plenty of restaurants nearby with reasonable prices (for Italy) and great food. We especially liked Andrea's two blocks from the hotel. The food was fantastic. Overall, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the hotel again if I travel to Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastico!!"”
Reviews.Author: EJBTelford_England
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 40th Birthday Weekend trip to Rome and stayed at the Crosti Hotel. We booked rooms online via the Ryanair website finding the Crosti Hotel the most reasonably priced accomodation in a location that made it easy to get to all the sights. The Termini Station and Metro were a 10 minute walk away, with the Colosseum being two stops one way and the Vatican city six stops the other. The staff were excellent and exceptionally helpful. Boris (one of the night reception staff) couldn't have been nicer on our arrival and made sure that we were fully armed with all the appropriate maps and tour information along with recommendations for places to eat. They really push " Mamma Angela's" with a tempting 10% discount but don't be put off.......it was really worth it; the food was good and the cheapest out of all the places we ate at during our stay! The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable - just what you need after a hard day's 'hoofing' around the city. Bedding and towels were changed every day as if by magic as we saw no staff around the hotel actually doing these tasks. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful and there was coffee by the bucket full if you so desired!! We were greeted every morning with a smile and a friendly buongiorno!! In summary, this is a very modern, friendly and comfortable hotel and my husband and I have no hesitation in recommending it for any length of stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWanjiru
Reviews.Content: Cozy, compact little hotel about a 10-minute walk from Termini train station. Rome's sidewalks are a bit bumpy if you're dragging luggage, though. If you take a taxi to Crosti Hotel, don't pay more than 10 euros. The staff is professional and helpful although they are a little stiff and may seem unfriendly. The breakfast was very nice and the room was quite comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Crosti”
Reviews.Author: FredoCorleone
Reviews.Content: Only found 2 or 3 reviews of this hotel before booking - and two were in Italian! - but we were very pleased. Actually out of 3 hotels we stayed at on our trip to Italy, this was our favorite. Clean, big rooms (we booked 2 singles) very large bathrooms that looked like they had been recently renovated, a friendly staff and great breakfast made it worth recommending to others. Only drawback would be the street noise, but it's in a busy area and with the windows closed you can't hear much. I would stay there again and tell others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with nice location and friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: sabinaJakarta
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel with great location. Very close to Termini station. The staffs are very friendly and helpfull. The room is nice, clean and great bathroom. Breakfast is nice with good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrikos
Reviews.Content: We stayed there four nights from feb. 18. Nice and clean Hotel with freindly and helpfull staff. Located in a quiet area near the Teremini Station. Short distance to all great attractions. The Hotel owns a very good restaurant on the same street. We will give the Hotel our best recomandations and off course we will come back when we visit this wonderfull city next time. Østergaard, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CanadianStudent_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in low season for only 40Euros a night (double room) which is amazing. I have told my friends about this place and they are apparently already booked a couple months in advance, for march and april. I stayed in other cities in Italy (Florence and Venice), and this was the cheapest hotel, yet best one. The hotel is quite new, so nothing is run down, and the staff are very friendly. Breakfast is better than any other free breakfast I've had in hotels in Europe. It is only a ten minute walk from the central train/subway station (Termini) which has links to all the major tourist attractions throughout the city. I would definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “really nice place - GREAT breakkie!”
Reviews.Author: mememe25
Reviews.Content: The crosti hotel is fantastic. i didn't want to stay in a hostel, but i didn't want to spend a whole heap of money on a hotel either. i found the crosti hotel by chance on the web and it was fantastic. The complimentary breakfast was delicious, cakes, tarts, coffe, yogurt, great service from the lady who made the coffee. It was so yummy. the location is close to the termini, but it might be considered a dodgy area, but the hotel itself was comfortable, clean, spacious, safe and friendly. i couldn't recommend it more. enjoy your stay there.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Crosti didn't disappoint!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caz_Dave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Crosti between 13th February and 16th February 2008. We'd seen previous reviews on Tripadvisor and were confident of a good quality hotel and that's exactly what we got. Excellent value for money, a very good location (10 mins slow walk from Termini train station and surrounded by small bars and restaurants) and friendly staff. Rooms were nicely presented with LCD TV, free in-room safe, mini bar and smart bathrooms (with showers that are so good you dont want to get out!) Good selection of continental fayre at breakfast (omelettes, fruit, cereal, cheeses, cold meats, bread rolls, cake, croissants) and excellent, and attentive, breakfast room staff. All in all, an excellent hotel, in a good location away from the hustle and bustle and good value for money. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leaperone
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crosti Hotel and had a wonderful experience. The staff were genuinely kind and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was thoughtfully presented and of good quality. My room was simple and clean. Yes, the surrounding area is a bit on the earthy side- but its also very close to Trimani wine bar and some very nice local restaurants. I certainly will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Ahabrum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Its right near Rome's termini station and it is so easier to get around and see Rome. The hotel is clean, the staff are super; they gave us advise on places to eat, go and the best way to get there. travelling was easy like using the underground but so clean and spacious even at rush times. The 2 bad things about the location were its next door to a strip club and on the same road as an adult cinema. The area is a little grim with a groups of men hanging around. I wouldnt suggest this area for girls only; if you have a big stong man with you its cool but else I would have felt a little scared Hotel though is fab!!!!
